title: Compensation Analyst
description:
### **About the role**

We are seeking an eager **Compensation Analyst** who is passionate about data and analytics. In this role, you will administer, update, and support the BetterComp proprietary market-pricing database. In tandem, you will build custom dashboards and analysis in support of our client portfolio.

You will work closely with cross-functional teams including Engineering, Product, and Customer Success, to diagnose issues, provide solutions, and ensure an exceptional customer experience. If you are a problem-solver who is passionate about data and helping customers succeed, we’d love to hear from you!

### **What you’ll do:**

* Ensure all data feeds are operating as intended between BetterComp and 3rd parties.
* Perform quality assurance procedures on proprietary database prior to periodic releases.
* Administer and expand proprietary market-pricing databases.
* Provide client support and market-pricing services to our client portfolio.
* Work with Customer Success on joint projects in support of client requests and initiatives.
* Provide feedback to Engineering and Product teams regarding recurring issues and feature requests based on customer insights.
* Engage with clients on projects related to custom dashboards and analysis reports.
* Ensure timely and effective resolution of customer requests, meeting or exceeding SLAs.
* Stay up to date with industry best practices, emerging technologies, and product updates.

### **What you bring:**

* 1-3 years of experience working as a compensation professional or business analyst.
* Experience working with Excel *(advanced)*, QuickSight, Tableau, or similar tools
* Experience working with and manipulating large datasets
* Strong troubleshooting skills with the ability to diagnose complex data issues
* Deliberate and methodical, with strong attention to detail.
* Familiarity with any basic programming is a plus
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to explain complicated concepts in a simplified manner.
* Strong customer empathy and problem-solving mindset.
* Ability to work independently and efficiently in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.

### **Why you’ll love it:**

BetterComp is transforming the way companies approach compensation, delivering modern, data-driven solutions that help organizations streamline pay practices, ensure fairness, and stay competitive. With a growing roster of enterprise clients, including many of the world’s largest companies, we’re redefining how compensation teams work.

As a fast-moving startup, we thrive on building what doesn’t yet exist—solving complex problems with creativity, agility, and a bias for action. At BetterComp, you’ll be part of a forward-thinking team that values bold ideas, empowers you to take ownership, and provides the support needed to grow your career.

Our success is driven by exceptional people. We hire top talent and give them the autonomy and space to do their best work. Here, you’ll collaborate with some of the most innovative and driven minds in the industry, tackling compensation’s toughest challenges and shaping the future of HRTech.

### **What we offer:**

* Our fully remote position, based in the U.S., offers you the freedom to work from the comfort of your home, giving you the flexibility you've always wanted.
* Competitive compensation package that includes:
* + Base salary range for this position: **$60,350 - $75,000** (annually based on experience and location)
  + Equity
* Flexible PTO, generous company holidays
* Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance
* 401(k) with company match

title: Digital Operations Data Coordinator
description:
**Drive Precision with Tech — Join Concrete Constructors LLC as a Digital Operations Data Coordinator!**

**Position Title:** Digital Operations Data Coordinator  
**Company Name:** Concrete Constructors LLC  
**Pay Rate:** $20.50 per hour + Performance Bonus  
**Employment Type:** Full-Time  
**Work Location:** Onsite, St. Louis, MO

**Job Overview**  
Are you obsessed with clean data, smart automation, and streamlined workflows? Concrete Constructors LLC is hiring a Digital Operations Data Coordinator to champion operational accuracy across our roofing and construction projects. You'll be at the center of digital transformation—merging real-time project data with powerful tools to fuel timely decisions, elevate team productivity, and uphold our promise of unparalleled customer service through direct communication.

**Who We Are**  
At Concrete Constructors LLC, known in the field as Constructors 911, we blend elite craftsmanship with cutting-edge technology to lead the roofing and exteriors industry. Our culture thrives on radical truth, proactive updates, and continual growth. When you join us, you join a team that values your voice, supports your development, and celebrates your impact.

**What You'll Do**

* Manage Data Flow: Enter, audit, and reconcile data across ERP, CRM, and field apps like JobNimbus, Google Drive, and CompanyCam.
* Generate Dashboards: Create Excel/Sheets or Power BI dashboards to deliver actionable insights for project managers and executives.
* Automate Tasks: Use formulas, Zapier/Make, or low-code tools to reduce manual inputs and improve workflow efficiency.
* Uphold Standards: Train team members on data best practices, enforce SOPs, and ensure data integrity supports transparent communication.
* Field Coordination: Gather and organize site photos, drone imagery, material receipts, and other documentation from field teams.
* Support Admin Tasks: Assist with scheduling in the system and preparing large contract paperwork packages.

**Ideal Candidate Profile**

* **Experience:** 1–3 years in data entry, project coordination, or operations support (construction/roofing experience preferred).
* **Technical Skills:** Spreadsheet fluency; familiarity with Power BI, Smartsheet, SQL, and field software tools is a plus.
* **Detail-Driven:** Meticulous in data accuracy and process documentation with a proactive “fix-it-now” mindset.
* **Communicator:** Clear, confident, and comfortable working with teams across departments.
* **Credentialed:** Associates degree preferred. Bonus if you hold a Google Data Analytics Certificate.
* Being bilingual in English/Spanish is a plus for supporting field communication.

**Benefits**

* **Competitive Pay:** $20.50/hour with KPI-based performance bonuses.
* **Full Benefits**: Medical, Dental, Vision insurance.
* **Work-Life Balance:** Paid time off for holidays, vacation, and sick leave.
* **Career Development:** Training, certifications, and a clear path to Data Analyst or Project Controls Specialist.
* **Unique Perks:** Company events, tech packages, and a culture that embraces innovation and continuous learning.

**Schedule**

* Monday – Friday (Full-Time)
* Overtime opportunities may arise as projects demand.

**Work Location**

* Onsite at Concrete Constructors LLC headquarters or project support office.

***Equal Opportunity Statement*** *Concrete Constructors LLC is committed to a culture where everyone is valued, respected, and empowered to grow. We proudly maintain an inclusive workplace and are an Equal Opportunity Employer, welcoming applicants of all backgrounds and identities.* ***If you're ready to blend tech and construction into a career of purpose and impact—apply today and help us build smarter, faster, and better at Constructors 911!***

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $20.50 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Overtime

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: In person

title: Software Business Systems Analyst
description:
Sol-Ark is a Veteran-owned solar and battery-based technology manufacturer based in Texas. Our mission is making the most reliable, innovative, and affordable solar storage solutions to power families & their businesses. Founded in 2013, the company has experienced massive, organic growth due to our equipment being 3x more powerful and capable than best-in-class alternatives. It is a fast-paced, yet casual work environment. We are a close-knit team looking to make significant contributions to a very fast-growing industry that values merit, character, aptitude, sustainability and self-reliance.

**Please use this link to apply:** https://zurl.to/vmsZ?source=CareerSite

**Location:** This position will be on-site at our corporate offices in Allen, Texas (Dallas-Fort Worth area).  
  
**Not a remote position.**  
  
Full-time W-2 ONSITE opportunity (not remote)!  
  
**Work Eligibility:**

* Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States without requiring employer-sponsored visa sponsorship now or in the future.
* At this time, we are unable to consider candidates on F1-OPT status.

We are seeking an experienced Software Business Systems Analyst with 7+ years of professional experience, specifically focused on creating detailed technical requirements /user stories for custom Java/JEE/Spring software for the cloud systems using agile requirements standards. The role requires inputs from Product Marketing, Sales and other business units and translates them into technical requirements that the technical team can develop. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical software background, excellent problem-solving skills, and a proven track record of delivering high-quality software requirements.  
  
**Responsibilities:**

* Translate high-level product requirements from MRD and PRD into technical requirements/user stories for the development teams to develop software.
* Develop user stories for UI, API, database, and other software systems and applications with input from product owner and development leads.
* Interface and participate in initial customer technical discussions to better evaluate project scope and tasks.
* Work with project manager/program office to keep all user stories, developer tasks updated and current based on the project changes and modifications for every sprint.
* Work with firmware teams to create requirements for software systems and applications.
* Work with an infrastructure team to create requirements for AWS Cloud.
* Work with vendors to help resolve bugs, issues, and technical debt.

**Software Support and Maintenance:**

* Collaborate with software developers, FW, QA, and infrastructure teams to help troubleshoot specific issues/bugs for software applications.
* Work with IT Support, vendors and various business teams to manage bug fix support by triaging, assessing for probable causes and impact.
* Provide support to software engineers by sharing necessary application domain knowledge that will help them fix the bugs promptly.

**Project Management Support:**

* Work with Product and business groups to correctly assess and prioritize bugs, by educating them of the level of impact and complexity involved.
* Works with development leads and product owner to identify workload for the team up to 2 months in advance.

**Requirements:**

* Work on JIRA Atlassian board to create user stories, epic, initiatives etc.
* Ability to write SQL queries to do data analysis for business problems to draw insights.
* Working knowledge of APIs, ability to write basic clients to APIs to test and instrument them for performance.
* Ability to create business process workflows for the end users.
* Experience using scripts and scripting languages e.g. Python, YAML, etc.
* Familiarity with writing requirements for Cloud monitoring, metrics and analytics i.e. dashboards using Grafana or similar tools.
* Excellent communication skills both vertically and horizontally within the organization related to all aspects of technical leadership – written and verbal.

**Salary and Benefits:** We offer a competitive salary and performance-based bonus program, top-tier benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k), and paid time off.  
  
**Work Eligibility:**  
Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States without requiring employer-sponsored visa sponsorship now or in the future. At this time, we are unable to consider candidates on F1-OPT status.  
  
**Please use this link to apply:** https://zurl.to/vmsZ?source=CareerSite

title: Medical Records Technician
description:
**Company Description**

International Health and Medical Services delivers customized medical and security risk management and wellbeing solutions to enable our clients to operate safely and effectively in environments far from home. Founded in 1984, we operate in 92 countries providing integrated medical solutions to organizations with international operations. Our innovative technology and medical and security expertise focus on prevention, offering real-time, actionable insights and on-the-ground quality delivery. We provide clinical services to include “hands on” direct care at over 800 sites around the world, many of which include inpatient clinical care capabilities. With 12,000 staff (including 5,200 medical and behavioral health providers) our services include the design, deployment, and operation of healthcare solutions including freestanding surgical facilities in remote and austere environments, telemedicine consultation through a wide range of virtual modalities, referrals to a global network of more than 100,000 vetted providers, and global aeromedical evacuation. Within our portfolio of companies, International Health and Medical Services headquartered in Houston, Texas provides contracted healthcare support to Government defense and civil agencies and government contractors, including support to military exercises and operations, diplomatic missions, natural disasters, and refugee care.

 **Job Description**

**This position is contingent on contract award.**

International Health and Medical Services is looking for an experienced Medical Records Technician to accurately manage and maintain patient health records, ensuring that all documentation is complete, organized, and compliant with legal and regulatory requirements. This role involves coding medical information for billing purposes, facilitating access to medical records for healthcare providers, and protecting patient confidentiality.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Provide subject matter expertise to leaders and medical center staff.
* Interpret and apply The Joint Commission standards and medico-legal requirements, current federal codes pertinent to medical records, directives and handbooks pertinent to health information management.
* Utilize coding principles and nomenclature and the MS-DRG system; CPT and E&M rules; medical and procedural terminology; anatomy and physiology, regulations governing confidentiality of medical records; release of information laws and statutes; records management; and any policies.
* Provides training for HIM, clinical and administrative staff on HIM topics.
* Performs quality improvement projects regarding HIM issues.
* Assists in preparing various presentations.
* Perform audits and analyses, prepare and present findings and recommendations to the leaders and medical staff.
* Review, analyze and report HIM performance monitors.
* Advises principal investigators and other clinical staff relating to methodologies of retrieving health care data for specific studies.
* Performs data retrieval for special studies as needed.
* Performs quantitative and qualitative reviews of health record documentation to ensure all patient care data entered in the electronic health record (EHR) is accurate, timely, and completed.
* Adheres to established documentation requirements as outlined by The Joint Commission (TJC) regulations and medical-legal requirements.
* Serve as a liaison in the implementation of automated clinical applications pertaining to the EHR.
* Participate in facility committees and subcommittees related to health information and provides technical advice when necessary.
* Participates in training related to VHA Healthcare Information Systems such as VistA, CPRS and other software packages as they relate to HIM job functions.
* Analyze clinical and administrative processes related to information flow.
* Tests and verifies software packages prior to activation in production mode.
* Coordinates with software developers in the local testing of software.

**This list is non-exhaustive, and the role holder may be required to undertake additional duties that are not specifically listed above.**

 **Qualifications**

**Basic Requirements/Certifications:**

* Coding Certification through AHIMA or AAPC -OR- HIM Certification through AHIMA -OR-Health Data Analyst Certification through AHIMA.
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office: Excel, Word, Power Point, Outlook (email), Windows, Social Media Platforms, and navigating the web.
* Must have excellent oral and written communications skills.
* Must have excellent customer service and self-organization skills.
* Applicants must have the ability to maintain effective working relationships with all levels of employees, both inside and outside the organization.
* Association (AHA) Basic Life Support (BLS).
* Trained in Basic First Aid.
* Employees shall have at least one year of general experience that demonstrates the following:
  + The ability to greet and deal tactfully with the public.
  + Capability of understanding and applying written and verbal orders, rules, and regulations. All personnel shall be literate and be able to interpret printed rules and regulations, detailed written orders, training instructions and materials, and must be able to compose reports.
  + Good judgment, courage, alertness, an even temperament, and render satisfactory performance through knowledge of his/her position responsibilities.
  + Ability to maintain poise and self-control during situations that involve mental stress, such as fires, explosions, civil disturbances, and building evacuations.

**Education Required:**

* Three years of experience in the field of medical records that included the preparation, maintenance, and management of records and health information systems [demonstrating a knowledge of medical terminology,] medical records [procedures, medical coding, or medical, administrative, and legal requirements of health care delivery] systems. -OR-
* Successful completion of a bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited college or university [recognized by the U.S. Department of Education, with a major field of study in health information management, or a related degree with a minimum of 24 semester hours in health information management or health information technology. -OR-
* Equivalent combinations of experience and education that equals 100 percent may be used to meet basic requirements.

**Physical Requirements:**

* This position is considered hazardous duty.
* Required to walk unaided at a normal pace for up to 5 minutes and maintain balance.
* Required to jog/fast walk up to ¼ mile.
* Requires physical exertion such as lifting objects greater than 30 pounds.
* Required to perform CPR/emergency care standing or kneeling.
* Must have the ability to assist sick, injured, or aging patients or staff exiting the building (may require lifting, dragging, wheeling, or carrying someone who weighs significantly more than self).
* Must be able to see, hear and smell with aids if necessary.
* Must be able to lift, push, or carry 30 pounds.
* Must perform the duties of my job in a stressful and often austere environment without physical limitations.
* Sitting and/or standing for extended periods of time.
* Average manual dexterity for computer operation.
* Phone or computer use for extended periods of time.

**Other Special Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 21 years of age.
* Must maintain current/physical residency in the continental U.S.
* Pass a medical examination conducted by a licensed physician within 30 days prior to initial assignment.
* Be a U.S. citizen or a person lawfully admitted into the U.S. for permanent residence.
* Have resided in the U.S. for the last five years (unless abroad on official U.S. government duty).
* Successfully engage in and complete a thorough Background Investigation.
* Poses or have ability to obtain required security clearances.
* Proficiency in Spanish is preferred.

  
**Additional Information**

*Pay range is based on several factors and may vary in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. Final salary and offer will be determined by the applicant’s background, experience, skills, internal equity, and alignment with geographical market data.*

Compensation: Min: $17/hr Max: $20/hr

*Benefits – Full-time positions are eligible for our comprehensive and competitive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. Additional benefits include a 401k plan paid time off and an annual bonus. International Health and Medical Services complies with all federal, state, and local minimum wage laws*

*International Health and Medical Services is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with the applicable federal, state and local laws.*

title: Technical Product Marketing Analyst
description:
**Company Description**

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**

**Role Overview:**

We are seeking a passionate and inquisitive Solution Product Marketing Analyst to join our Value-Added Services Marketing team. In this role, you will be encouraged to think like a journalist—peeling back the onion to uncover insights and asking the questions that others might overlook. Your ability to put yourself in the shoes of both sellers and buyers will be instrumental in creating compelling mid-funnel marketing materials. Your strong storytelling, writing, and presentation skills will support our solution selling efforts and enhance client engagement.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Product Research: Conduct thorough research to gain a deep understanding of Visa’s products and services and their value propositions, assisting the team in crafting compelling marketing narratives.
* Sales Pitch and Presentation Development: Create compelling, high-quality sales pitches and presentations that effectively communicate Visa’s value propositions for our Value-Added Services.
* Tear Sheet Creation: Design informative tear sheets that offer concise and relevant information about products and services.
* Account-Based Marketing (ABM): Collaborate on targeted, personalized marketing efforts to enhance client engagement through strategic ABM initiatives.
* Sales Material Development: Build robust marketing materials, including presentations, demos, and one-pagers, to support the sales team.
* Storytelling and Writing: Utilize strong writing and storytelling skills to develop engaging and informative marketing materials, including presentations, demos, and one-pagers.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with product management, sales, and other teams to gather insights and ensure marketing materials align with product strategies and customer needs.
* Attention to Detail: Ensure accuracy and consistency in all marketing materials, maintaining high standards of quality and alignment with brand messaging.
* Innovation Contribution: Participate in brainstorming sessions, contributing innovative ideas and approaches to enhance marketing strategies and collateral.
* Project Management: Manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery of marketing materials and adherence to deadlines.
* Growth Mindset: Life-long learner who continually stretches themselves to learn more and test their boundaries in risk, payments, and product knowledge. Comfortable with change and ambiguity, and willing to actively pursue answers or ask questions to understand more.
* Go-To-Market Collaboration: Assist in planning GTM strategies for new product launches and feature enhancements with cross-functional teams to ensure successful rollouts.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.

 **Qualifications**

Basic Qualifications:

* 2 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD, or PhD)

Preferred Qualifications:

* 3 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or more than 2 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD)
* Minimum 3 years of experience in B2B marketing or sales enablement, preferably in financial services, banking, or FinTech.
* Proven experience in creating effective sales pitches and sales materials.
* Exceptional writing skills with the ability to create compelling sales narratives.
* Strong business acumen and understanding of the industry ecosystem.
* Excellent presentation skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work collaboratively across teams and manage multiple projects effectively.
* Driven and self-motivated, with a passion for understanding products and driving marketing success.
* Curious mindset, not afraid to ask questions and dig deeper to uncover insights.
* Ability to empathize with both sellers and buyers to create relevant and impactful marketing materials.

  
**Additional Information**

**Work Hours:** Varies upon the needs of the department.

**Travel Requirements:** This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.

**Mental/Physical Requirements:** This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

**U.S. APPLICANTS ONLY: The estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is 84,600.00 to 119,650.00 USD per year, which may include potential sales incentive payments (if applicable). Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity. Visa has a comprehensive benefits package for which this position may be eligible that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401 (k), FSA/HSA, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, and Wellness Program.**
company_addresses:
One Market Plaza, 5th Floor
San Francisco, CA 94105
company_description: Our Purpose is to... Uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

title: Distribution Solutions Analyst, Client Success
description:
**Company Description**

Curinos empowers financial institutions to make better, faster and more profitable decisions through industry-leading proprietary data, technologies and insights. With decades-long expertise in the financial services industry and a relentless focus on the future, Curinos technology and analytics ecosystem allows clients to anticipate customer needs and optimize their go-to market decisions in an increasingly competitive market.

Curinos operates under a **hybrid modality**. We have hub office locations in **New York City, Chicago, Toronto, and London. Our Preference would be for this person to be in the New York City Metropolitan area.**

 **Job Description**

Curinos is seeking a Client Success Analyst to help our clients transition effectively to a digital-first world – optimizing customer-facing channels for sales and service, including the branch network, ATMs, staffing and digital (online/mobile). In this role, you will enhance the value of our SaaS data and analytical solutions by guiding clients through data gathering, product implementation and onboarding, supporting day-to-day analytic and service needs, and aiding efforts for retention and renewal. Daily, you will work with internal teams and external clients to tackle their individual challenges, such as data collection, data quality assurance, how to best utilize Curinos data to answer their pressing questions and the best approach to leveraging insights to drive impact.

Client Implementation and On-boarding:

* Serve as the lead for data collection for the distribution product set that focuses on network planning
* Manage project timelines and deliverables for client implementations
* Partner with engineering and data teams to execute implementations effectively
* Define business requirements for new solutions implementations and/or existing client enhancements
* Identify and develop processes that improve efficiency of data and research reports

Client Success Support:

* Know your clients’ strategies and data inside and out
* Synthesize data-driven insights from our solutions and present findings to key client stakeholders
* Build impactful client relationships by serving as a primary point of contact for the client team, including leading client calls and in person meetings
* Provide clients with timely support for questions about both our solutions platform and industry experience
* Design and lead solutions training sessions to help our clients find value in the analytics and tools they license from Curinos

Other:

* Identify product issues or opportunities for our clients, develop hypotheses, and engage in solutions brainstorming
* Partner closely with the technical solutions teams to deliver actionable results

 **Qualifications**

* 1-5 years of experience in Retail Banking, Consulting, Financial Services, and/or Business Intelligence; alternative experience requiring strong data and analytics background would also be applicable
* 0-3 years of experience working in SQL or with relational databases. Experience with Python and/or R is preferred but not required
* You are a natural and relentless problem solver who is passionate about delivering value to clients through the application of analytics. You demonstrate an ease with complex quantitative analysis, a drive to succeed, and creativity in problem solving
* Passion for the details and finding the best answer
* Proven track record of delivering complex, time-sensitive work to clients, across multiple client workstreams
* Strong analytical capabilities including the ability to interpret complex analytics
* Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a focus on effective storytelling and working with clients
* Excellent organizational and time management skills; attention to detail
* Ability to travel as needed for client meetings; can range from 0% to 100% depending on engagement, but will most likely be ~10-20%
* Bachelor’s degree

Compensation: This position offers a base salary of $70,000-$80,000 with bonus potential

 **Additional Information**

**Why work at Curinos?**

* Competitive benefits, including a range of Financial, Health and Lifestyle benefits to choose from
* Flexible working options, including home working, flexible hours and part time options, depending on the role requirements – please ask!
* Competitive annual leave, floating holidays, volunteering days and a day off for your birthday!
* Learning and development tools to assist with your career development
* Work with industry leading Subject Matter Experts and specialist products
* Regular social events and networking opportunities
* Collaborative, supportive culture, including an active DE&I program
* Employee Assistance Program which provides expert third-party advice on wellbeing, relationships, legal and financial matters, as well as access to counselling services

**Applying:**

We know that sometimes the 'perfect candidate' doesn't exist, and that people can be put off applying for a job if they don't meet all the requirements. If you're excited about working for us and have relevant skills or experience, please go ahead and apply. You could be just what we need!

If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats, special requirements to access our buildings or adjusted interview formats please contact us at careers@curinos.com and we’ll do everything we can to help.

**Inclusivity at Curinos:**

We believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, Curinos is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other protected characteristics.

title: Manager, Data Science, Media Group Decision Sciences
description:
**Company Description**

NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies. We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

Our impact is rooted in improving the communities where our employees, customers, and audiences live and work. We have a rich tradition of giving back and ensuring our employees have the opportunity to serve their communities. We champion an inclusive culture and strive to attract and develop a talented workforce to create and deliver a wide range of content reflecting our world.

Comcast NBCUniversal has announced its intent to create a new publicly traded company ('SpinCo') comprised of most of NBCUniversal's cable television networks, including USA Network, CNBC, MSNBC, Oxygen, E!, SYFY and Golf Channel along with complementary digital assets Fandango, Rotten Tomatoes, GolfNow, GolfPass, and SportsEngine. The well-capitalized company will have significant scale as a pure-play set of assets anchored by leading news, sports and entertainment content. The spin-off is expected to be completed during 2025.

 **Job Description**

The Media Group at NBCU supports a powerhouse collection of consumer-first brands including Peacock, NBC, Bravo, NBC Sports, and NBCU International. With unequalled scale, our teams make the most out of every opportunity to collaborate and learn from one another. We’re always looking for ways to innovate faster, accelerate our growth and consistently offer the very best in consumer experience. But most of all, we’re backed by a culture of respect. We embrace authenticity and inspire people to thrive.

As part of the Media Group Decision Sciences team, this Manager of Data Science will be responsible for leading a team of Data Scientists focused on developing solutions to optimize our content, partnering closely with business stakeholders, analysts, and engineers. The Manger will be tasked with building and deploying scalable, data science and AI/ML driven, solutions to empower decisions specifically focused around show opportunities. The Manager will leverage a wide spectrum of data, their expertise in statistical methods and applied machine learning, and their understanding of the Media business to deliver impactful lift to our enterprise metrics.

**Responsibilities:**

* Partner closely with key business stakeholders and teams (e.g. Content Strategy, Research, Advanced Analytics, Production teams) to define priorities, approaches, and business requirements for data science solutions and experiments
* Own and deliver results on existing and new complex projects related to our understanding of content
* Serve as a team expert in statistical methods and applied machine learning
* Translate complex problems and solutions to all levels of the organization
* Manage processes, platforms, and people in the audience optimization space
* Drive innovation of the methodologies and tools used by the team
* Collaborate with cross-portfolio and cross-platform Decision Sciences leads to understand different audience dynamics between Peacock content & customers and other NBCU businesses, brands and franchises
* Help contribute to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work culture at Peacock

  
**Qualifications**  

* PhD or MS within a quantitative or technical field (i.e. Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research, etc)
* 4+ years experience practically applying statistical methods or machine learning techniques in an industry or research environment
* Experience in leading small teams on commercial projects.
* Advanced level knowledge of statistical methods and machine learning. Ability to define the direction for a project and select appropriate methods and tools using up to date knowledge of recent advancements
* Demonstrated experience working with external stakeholders from across the organization
* Experience using data visualization tools and techniques to deliver and present business insights and value
* Proficiency in Python and SQL

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Experience implementing scalable systems using Databricks or similar cloud platform.
* Experience with ownership of data products, either internal or consumer-facing
* Experience owning data pipelines and machine learning pipelines
* Strong oral and written communication skills
* Team-oriented and collaborative with an aptitude and willingness to learn
* Strong sense of curiosity, accountability, and ability to execute projects of all sizes with vision & purpose
* Video/TV/Streaming content enthusiast

**Additional Requirements:**

**Fully Remote:** This position has been designated as fully remote, meaning that the position is expected to contribute from a non-NBCUniversal worksite, most commonly an employee’s residence.

This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website.

*Salary range: $145,000 - $180,000 (bonus and long-term incentive eligible)*

 **Additional Information**

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

For LA County and City Residents Only: NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories, or arrest or conviction records, in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the California Fair Chance Act, where applicable.

title: Global Head of Sales Operations
description:
**Job Description**

**Join the team redefining how the world experiences design**

Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time-consuming, and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.

**Where and how you can work**

Our flagship office is in Sydney, Australia, but we've made our way from down under to our hubs in San Francisco and Austin, which are now home to our US operations. We offer flexibility in how and where you work. We trust our Canvanauts to choose the balance that empowers them and their team to achieve their goals.

**What you’d be doing in this role**

We’re investing in the next phase of our Sales Operations function to unlock smarter, faster, and more AI-augmented go-to-market execution. We're looking for a Sales Operations leader to own our global sales operations team and business partner model with Sales, Customer Success, Finance, and Partnerships teams.

This is a high-impact leadership role where you’ll shape how we manage sales territories, bookings, forecasting, policies, systems, and the operational stack that powers our field teams. You’ll help bridge the gap between self-serve and enterprise sales motions, operationalizing our evolving PLG strategy, and supporting Canva’s revenue growth at scale.

**At the moment, this role is focused on:**

* Leading and evolving the global Sales Operations function, overseeing strategy, systems, and scalable processes across the full GTM motion.
* Owning core revenue operations processes, including CRM enrichment and hygiene, territory design, lead routing, pipeline and forecast management, and sales performance measurement.
* Building and driving forecasting accuracy and cadence in partnership with Sales leadership and Finance, enabling clear visibility into performance and planning.
* Driving Bookings Policy design and Deal Desk alignment, ensuring governance, compliance, and efficiency while enabling high-velocity deal flow.
* Establishing and maintaining Rules of Engagement and Sales Policy frameworks that support fair, efficient, and productive selling across regions and segments.
* Partnering deeply with Sales, Customer Success, and Partnerships leaders through a Field Operations business partner model, supporting regional nuances and go-to-market priorities.
* Operationalizing product-led sales signals, ensuring sellers have the right data, context, and triggers to act on user intent and product usage insights.
* Collaborating cross-functionally with Sales Systems, Growth, Finance, Legal, and Enablement to ensure strong alignment, process excellence, and data-driven decision-making across the revenue engine.
* Hiring, developing, and scaling a high-performing team of revenue operations analysts and leads, fostering a culture of excellence, innovation, and continuous improvement.

**You're probably a match if you have:**

* A wealth of experience in Sales, Revenue, or Business Operations at a fast-scaling SaaS company in a senior leadership role.
* Led and scaled global Sales Ops teams and know how to balance strategic leadership with operational execution.
* Deep expertise across the sales operations stack, including forecasting, territory and quota planning, deal desk, pipeline management, lead routing, and CRM governance.
* A track record of building and running accurate, scalable forecasting processes in collaboration with Sales and Finance stakeholders.
* You're a strong business partner who can influence and collaborate across Sales, CS, Partnerships, Finance, Product, and Marketing orgs.
* Experience or strong interest in supporting Product-Led Growth (PLG) motions, and understanding how to bridge product signals and sales workflows.
* A strong understanding of Customer Success and Partnership Operations, and how those teams intersect with sales growth.
* You’re excited by the future of AI in Sales Ops and are already hands-on with AI-native tools (we use Clay and Pocus) or similar platforms.
* You’re highly analytical and systems-minded, but also have the EQ and communication skills to influence at the executive level.
* You're energized by building—you love to scale smart, reduce friction, and empower others to do their best work.

**About the team:**

This role sits within the GTM Operations organization at Canva. GTM Operations brings together Strategy & Programs, Systems, Enablement, and Field Operations to power Canva’s global Sales, Customer Success, and Partnerships teams. Together, we enable Canva’s hybrid go-to-market motion — blending product-led growth with high-touch sales — to empower the world to design, while scaling efficiently and intelligently.

 **Additional Information**

**What's in it for you?**

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity, and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a range of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here's a taste of what's on offer:

* Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too
* Health benefits plan to support you and your well-being
* 401(k) retirement plan with company contribution
* Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
* An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more
* Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge, and support you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

At Canva, we value fairness, and we strive to provide competitive, market-informed compensation whilst ensuring internal equity within the team in each region. We make hiring decisions based on your skills, experience, and our overall assessment of what we observed and learned in the hiring process. The salary range for this position is $228,000 to $348,000. When calculating offers, we make salary decisions based on market data and candidates' skills and experience.

**Other stuff to know**

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills, and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva, so even if you don’t feel like your skills quite match what’s listed above - we still want to hear from you!

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

#LI-JP1
company_description: Canva is changing the way the world designs.

title: Cybersecurity Certification and Accreditation Analyst (Off-Site) DOD SECRET REQUIRED
description:
Serves as a cybersecurity Subject Matter Expert (SME) with regards to the authorization of information systems and all associated cybersecurity policies and procedures. Fully versed in the general tenets supporting the overall DOD implementation of its authorization process, to include supporting cybersecurity policy, procedures and processes. Performs a DOD cybersecurity process while either authorizing an information system or serving as a SME for an information system undergoing authorization. Possess an understanding of how the security controls identified in the NIST 800-53 apply to the process of assessing and authorizing a large organization’s IT infrastructure such as DLA’s, in which there is a compilation of large and small enclaves, AIS applications and outsourced IT processes. Determines the applicable severity value for an identified vulnerability (e.g., non-compliant security control), and determines the possible ramifications on the system’s current or future authorization. Required to brief senior management on the progress or results of an information system undergoing the authorization process.

* **Minimum Experience:**
* Five (5) years of relevant C&A experience; and NIST C&A experience; DOD cybersecurity experience
* DOD Secret Clearance.
* **Must be eligible for IT II**
* **Relevant certification meeting DOD 8570.01 IAM level III**
* Experience in assessing security controls and conducting authorization reviews for large, complex organizations.

**2.3.1.1.1** Workflow Process Template Development and Maintenance

The contractor shall design, develop, implement, and maintain a suite of standardized templates that support the tracking and management of workflow processes. These templates will enhance efficiency, consistency, and transparency in process monitoring and reporting (e.g. AVT, CONMON, Annual Review and Authorization summaries).

The contractor shall be responsible for the following tasks:

* Needs Assessment:

o Collaborate with key stakeholders to gather requirements for workflow tracking templates.

o Identify existing documentation or systems that may influence template development.

* Template Development:

o Design templates suitable for various workflow processes, including but not limited to task tracking, progress monitoring, and approvals.

o Ensure templates are user-friendly, scalable, and compatible with the organization’s existing tools (e.g., Excel, Word, SharePoint, or workflow management systems).

* Template Maintenance:

o Perform regular updates to templates based on user feedback and evolving agency needs.

o Ensure version control and maintain documentation for all changes made.

* Training and Support:

o Provide initial training to staff on the proper use of templates.

o Offer ongoing technical support and guidance as needed.

* Quality Assurance:

o Test templates for functionality, reliability, and data accuracy.

o Ensure alignment with organizational standards, policies, and best practices.

**2.3.5.4 A-123/Statement of Assurance (SOA)/ IT General Controls (ITGC) Support**

The contractor will assist with performing testing and validation of SM controls that will include but are not limited to Financial Statement, OMB A-123/SOA testing, ITGC testing. Some of this SM testing will occur annually but most will follow a continuous testing methodology in accordance to the enterprise schedule. This testing consists of roughly 50 SM specific controls (subject to change in accordance with DoD or DLA guidance), spanning Financial Management systems deemed as in-scope that cycle by J6TB. In addition, testing will include all J6TB designated Complementary User Entity Controls (CUEC’s), as well as retesting of previous audit cycle closed NFRs.

2.3.5.4.1 Audit Summary Trend Analysis Support

The contractor shall perform ongoing analysis of audit findings related to security management (SM) across DLA systems. A weekly audit summary report shall be produced that captures the key points, decisions, and discussions from all meetings conducted during the week. This report shall also include an ongoing detailed list of taskings derived from Provided by Customer (PBC), Control Observation (CO) and Notifications of Findings and Recommendations (NFR), specifying the responsible individuals or teams, deadlines, and current status of each task assigned during the meetings. The summary shall be compiled and made available to the government no later than the first business day by 3 PM each week.

Data Collection and Tracking: Establish a centralized mechanism (e.g., spreadsheet, database) to collect and track SM-related audit findings, including:

Audit type (FSA, GAO, SOIDC, etc.)

· System/application affected

· Specific control deficiency

· Severity level (high, moderate, low)

· Remediation status

Trend Analysis: Regularly analyze the collected data to identify trends and patterns in SM-related audit findings. This includes:

· Identifying recurring control deficiencies across systems/audits.

· Analyzing the root causes of common findings.

· Assessing the effectiveness of existing remediation efforts.

Reporting and Recommendations: Prepare and deliver periodic reports to SM EOPR summarizing:

· Key audit finding trends and their potential impact on DLA.

· Recommendations for proactive measures to address recurring control deficiencies and improve SM posture.

· Insights to inform policy updates, training programs, and system security enhancements.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Medical Records Technician
description:
**Company Description**

International Health and Medical Services delivers customized medical and security risk management and wellbeing solutions to enable our clients to operate safely and effectively in environments far from home. Founded in 1984, we operate in 92 countries providing integrated medical solutions to organizations with international operations. Our innovative technology and medical and security expertise focus on prevention, offering real-time, actionable insights and on-the-ground quality delivery. We provide clinical services to include “hands on” direct care at over 800 sites around the world, many of which include inpatient clinical care capabilities. With 12,000 staff (including 5,200 medical and behavioral health providers) our services include the design, deployment, and operation of healthcare solutions including freestanding surgical facilities in remote and austere environments, telemedicine consultation through a wide range of virtual modalities, referrals to a global network of more than 100,000 vetted providers, and global aeromedical evacuation. Within our portfolio of companies, International Health and Medical Services headquartered in Houston, Texas provides contracted healthcare support to Government defense and civil agencies and government contractors, including support to military exercises and operations, diplomatic missions, natural disasters, and refugee care.

 **Job Description**

**This position is contingent on contract award.**

International Health and Medical Services is looking for an experienced Medical Records Technician to accurately manage and maintain patient health records, ensuring that all documentation is complete, organized, and compliant with legal and regulatory requirements. This role involves coding medical information for billing purposes, facilitating access to medical records for healthcare providers, and protecting patient confidentiality.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Provide subject matter expertise to leaders and medical center staff.
* Interpret and apply The Joint Commission standards and medico-legal requirements, current federal codes pertinent to medical records, directives and handbooks pertinent to health information management.
* Utilize coding principles and nomenclature and the MS-DRG system; CPT and E&M rules; medical and procedural terminology; anatomy and physiology, regulations governing confidentiality of medical records; release of information laws and statutes; records management; and any policies.
* Provides training for HIM, clinical and administrative staff on HIM topics.
* Performs quality improvement projects regarding HIM issues.
* Assists in preparing various presentations.
* Perform audits and analyses, prepare and present findings and recommendations to the leaders and medical staff.
* Review, analyze and report HIM performance monitors.
* Advises principal investigators and other clinical staff relating to methodologies of retrieving health care data for specific studies.
* Performs data retrieval for special studies as needed.
* Performs quantitative and qualitative reviews of health record documentation to ensure all patient care data entered in the electronic health record (EHR) is accurate, timely, and completed.
* Adheres to established documentation requirements as outlined by The Joint Commission (TJC) regulations and medical-legal requirements.
* Serve as a liaison in the implementation of automated clinical applications pertaining to the EHR.
* Participate in facility committees and subcommittees related to health information and provides technical advice when necessary.
* Participates in training related to VHA Healthcare Information Systems such as VistA, CPRS and other software packages as they relate to HIM job functions.
* Analyze clinical and administrative processes related to information flow.
* Tests and verifies software packages prior to activation in production mode.
* Coordinates with software developers in the local testing of software.

**This list is non-exhaustive, and the role holder may be required to undertake additional duties that are not specifically listed above.**

 **Qualifications**

**Basic Requirements/Certifications:**

* Coding Certification through AHIMA or AAPC -OR- HIM Certification through AHIMA -OR-Health Data Analyst Certification through AHIMA.
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office: Excel, Word, Power Point, Outlook (email), Windows, Social Media Platforms, and navigating the web.
* Must have excellent oral and written communications skills.
* Must have excellent customer service and self-organization skills.
* Applicants must have the ability to maintain effective working relationships with all levels of employees, both inside and outside the organization.
* Association (AHA) Basic Life Support (BLS).
* Trained in Basic First Aid.
* Employees shall have at least one year of general experience that demonstrates the following:
  + The ability to greet and deal tactfully with the public.
  + Capability of understanding and applying written and verbal orders, rules, and regulations. All personnel shall be literate and be able to interpret printed rules and regulations, detailed written orders, training instructions and materials, and must be able to compose reports.
  + Good judgment, courage, alertness, an even temperament, and render satisfactory performance through knowledge of his/her position responsibilities.
  + Ability to maintain poise and self-control during situations that involve mental stress, such as fires, explosions, civil disturbances, and building evacuations.

**Education Required:**

* Three years of experience in the field of medical records that included the preparation, maintenance, and management of records and health information systems [demonstrating a knowledge of medical terminology,] medical records [procedures, medical coding, or medical, administrative, and legal requirements of health care delivery] systems. -OR-
* Successful completion of a bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited college or university [recognized by the U.S. Department of Education, with a major field of study in health information management, or a related degree with a minimum of 24 semester hours in health information management or health information technology. -OR-
* Equivalent combinations of experience and education that equals 100 percent may be used to meet basic requirements.

**Physical Requirements:**

* This position is considered hazardous duty.
* Required to walk unaided at a normal pace for up to 5 minutes and maintain balance.
* Required to jog/fast walk up to ¼ mile.
* Requires physical exertion such as lifting objects greater than 30 pounds.
* Required to perform CPR/emergency care standing or kneeling.
* Must have the ability to assist sick, injured, or aging patients or staff exiting the building (may require lifting, dragging, wheeling, or carrying someone who weighs significantly more than self).
* Must be able to see, hear and smell with aids if necessary.
* Must be able to lift, push, or carry 30 pounds.
* Must perform the duties of my job in a stressful and often austere environment without physical limitations.
* Sitting and/or standing for extended periods of time.
* Average manual dexterity for computer operation.
* Phone or computer use for extended periods of time.

**Other Special Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 21 years of age.
* Must maintain current/physical residency in the continental U.S.
* Pass a medical examination conducted by a licensed physician within 30 days prior to initial assignment.
* Be a U.S. citizen or a person lawfully admitted into the U.S. for permanent residence.
* Have resided in the U.S. for the last five years (unless abroad on official U.S. government duty).
* Successfully engage in and complete a thorough Background Investigation.
* Poses or have ability to obtain required security clearances.
* Proficiency in Spanish is preferred.

  
**Additional Information**

*Pay range is based on several factors and may vary in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. Final salary and offer will be determined by the applicant’s background, experience, skills, internal equity, and alignment with geographical market data.*

Compensation: Min: $22/hr Max: $25/hr

*Benefits – Full-time positions are eligible for our comprehensive and competitive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. Additional benefits include a 401k plan paid time off and an annual bonus. International Health and Medical Services complies with all federal, state, and local minimum wage laws*

*International Health and Medical Services is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with the applicable federal, state and local laws.*

title: Medical Records Technician
description:
**Company Description**

International Health and Medical Services delivers customized medical and security risk management and wellbeing solutions to enable our clients to operate safely and effectively in environments far from home. Founded in 1984, we operate in 92 countries providing integrated medical solutions to organizations with international operations. Our innovative technology and medical and security expertise focus on prevention, offering real-time, actionable insights and on-the-ground quality delivery. We provide clinical services to include “hands on” direct care at over 800 sites around the world, many of which include inpatient clinical care capabilities. With 12,000 staff (including 5,200 medical and behavioral health providers) our services include the design, deployment, and operation of healthcare solutions including freestanding surgical facilities in remote and austere environments, telemedicine consultation through a wide range of virtual modalities, referrals to a global network of more than 100,000 vetted providers, and global aeromedical evacuation. Within our portfolio of companies, International Health and Medical Services headquartered in Houston, Texas provides contracted healthcare support to Government defense and civil agencies and government contractors, including support to military exercises and operations, diplomatic missions, natural disasters, and refugee care.

 **Job Description**

**This position is contingent on contract award.**

International Health and Medical Services is looking for an experienced Medical Records Technician to accurately manage and maintain patient health records, ensuring that all documentation is complete, organized, and compliant with legal and regulatory requirements. This role involves coding medical information for billing purposes, facilitating access to medical records for healthcare providers, and protecting patient confidentiality.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Provide subject matter expertise to leaders and medical center staff.
* Interpret and apply The Joint Commission standards and medico-legal requirements, current federal codes pertinent to medical records, directives and handbooks pertinent to health information management.
* Utilize coding principles and nomenclature and the MS-DRG system; CPT and E&M rules; medical and procedural terminology; anatomy and physiology, regulations governing confidentiality of medical records; release of information laws and statutes; records management; and any policies.
* Provides training for HIM, clinical and administrative staff on HIM topics.
* Performs quality improvement projects regarding HIM issues.
* Assists in preparing various presentations.
* Perform audits and analyses, prepare and present findings and recommendations to the leaders and medical staff.
* Review, analyze and report HIM performance monitors.
* Advises principal investigators and other clinical staff relating to methodologies of retrieving health care data for specific studies.
* Performs data retrieval for special studies as needed.
* Performs quantitative and qualitative reviews of health record documentation to ensure all patient care data entered in the electronic health record (EHR) is accurate, timely, and completed.
* Adheres to established documentation requirements as outlined by The Joint Commission (TJC) regulations and medical-legal requirements.
* Serve as a liaison in the implementation of automated clinical applications pertaining to the EHR.
* Participate in facility committees and subcommittees related to health information and provides technical advice when necessary.
* Participates in training related to VHA Healthcare Information Systems such as VistA, CPRS and other software packages as they relate to HIM job functions.
* Analyze clinical and administrative processes related to information flow.
* Tests and verifies software packages prior to activation in production mode.
* Coordinates with software developers in the local testing of software.

**This list is non-exhaustive, and the role holder may be required to undertake additional duties that are not specifically listed above.**

 **Qualifications**

**Basic Requirements/Certifications:**

* Coding Certification through AHIMA or AAPC -OR- HIM Certification through AHIMA -OR-Health Data Analyst Certification through AHIMA.
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office: Excel, Word, Power Point, Outlook (email), Windows, Social Media Platforms, and navigating the web.
* Must have excellent oral and written communications skills.
* Must have excellent customer service and self-organization skills.
* Applicants must have the ability to maintain effective working relationships with all levels of employees, both inside and outside the organization.
* Association (AHA) Basic Life Support (BLS).
* Trained in Basic First Aid.
* Employees shall have at least one year of general experience that demonstrates the following:
  + The ability to greet and deal tactfully with the public.
  + Capability of understanding and applying written and verbal orders, rules, and regulations. All personnel shall be literate and be able to interpret printed rules and regulations, detailed written orders, training instructions and materials, and must be able to compose reports.
  + Good judgment, courage, alertness, an even temperament, and render satisfactory performance through knowledge of his/her position responsibilities.
  + Ability to maintain poise and self-control during situations that involve mental stress, such as fires, explosions, civil disturbances, and building evacuations.

**Education Required:**

* Three years of experience in the field of medical records that included the preparation, maintenance, and management of records and health information systems [demonstrating a knowledge of medical terminology,] medical records [procedures, medical coding, or medical, administrative, and legal requirements of health care delivery] systems. -OR-
* Successful completion of a bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited college or university [recognized by the U.S. Department of Education, with a major field of study in health information management, or a related degree with a minimum of 24 semester hours in health information management or health information technology. -OR-
* Equivalent combinations of experience and education that equals 100 percent may be used to meet basic requirements.

**Physical Requirements:**

* This position is considered hazardous duty.
* Required to walk unaided at a normal pace for up to 5 minutes and maintain balance.
* Required to jog/fast walk up to ¼ mile.
* Requires physical exertion such as lifting objects greater than 30 pounds.
* Required to perform CPR/emergency care standing or kneeling.
* Must have the ability to assist sick, injured, or aging patients or staff exiting the building (may require lifting, dragging, wheeling, or carrying someone who weighs significantly more than self).
* Must be able to see, hear and smell with aids if necessary.
* Must be able to lift, push, or carry 30 pounds.
* Must perform the duties of my job in a stressful and often austere environment without physical limitations.
* Sitting and/or standing for extended periods of time.
* Average manual dexterity for computer operation.
* Phone or computer use for extended periods of time.

**Other Special Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 21 years of age.
* Must maintain current/physical residency in the continental U.S.
* Pass a medical examination conducted by a licensed physician within 30 days prior to initial assignment.
* Be a U.S. citizen or a person lawfully admitted into the U.S. for permanent residence.
* Have resided in the U.S. for the last five years (unless abroad on official U.S. government duty).
* Successfully engage in and complete a thorough Background Investigation.
* Poses or have ability to obtain required security clearances.
* Proficiency in Spanish is preferred.

  
**Additional Information**

*Pay range is based on several factors and may vary in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. Final salary and offer will be determined by the applicant’s background, experience, skills, internal equity, and alignment with geographical market data.*

Compensation: Min: $22/hr Max: $25/hr

*Benefits – Full-time positions are eligible for our comprehensive and competitive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. Additional benefits include a 401k plan paid time off and an annual bonus. International Health and Medical Services complies with all federal, state, and local minimum wage laws*

*International Health and Medical Services is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with the applicable federal, state and local laws.*

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Overview**  
We are looking for a personable and skilled Entry Level Data Analyst to join our team and help us transform data into actionable insights and grow our business. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, be detail-oriented, and be able to communicate complex data insights in a simplified and straightforward manner. This role involves working to identify data needs, creating spreadsheets, gathering & entering data, performing analysis, creating visualizations and reports, as well as regular maintenance of data systems for sales, inventory management, finance, and ecommerce. The role is not limited and offers a range of functions including regular contact with customers and other daily activities.

**Responsibilities**

Data Collection and Management:

* Gather, clean, enter and organize data from multiple sources to ensure data integrity and accuracy.
* Maintain databases and data systems, ensuring they are up-to-date and functional.

Data Analysis:

* Perform detailed data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
* Use statistical methods and software to interpret data sets and provide meaningful analysis.

Reporting and Visualization:

* Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to present data insights in an accessible and understandable manner.
* Communicate findings through presentations, reports, and meetings.

Collaboration and Support:

* Work with staff and vendors/developers to understand the data needs and provide analytical support.
* Assist in the development and implementation of data-driven strategies to improve business performance.

Quality Assurance:

* Conduct regular audits to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
* Identify and resolve data-related issues promptly.
* Perform Server & Database Systems backups & admin functions.

Client Facing Responsibilities:

* Complete essential day-to-day customer service and operational processes.
* Assist with customer requests and order fulfillment.
* Physically lifting and moving products weighing up to 70 pounds, unassisted.

**Qualifications:**

* Equivalent knowledge or bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Python, R, and Excel.

* Customer service experience in B2B and retail environments.

* Personally knows at least one president, two members of congress, and 3 billionaires.
