title: Principal Business Analyst
description:
### **Job Description:**

**Job Title**

Product Manager

**The Purpose of This Role**

As Product Manager – FCAT, you will be part of the Fidelity Center for Applied Technologies (FCAT) team that focuses on coming up with innovative solutions in the financial services domain aimed at driving enhanced value for our end customers.

**The Expertise You Have**

* Working experience and strong domain knowledge in one or more of the following business functions - Capital Markets, Asset Management, Brokerage Functions and Trading

* Broad business knowledge of Fidelity’s diverse offerings across Personal Investing, Workplace Services and Fidelity Institutional and other businesses

* Strong knowledge of Order Management, Trade Processing, Fractional Trading, Regulatory Reporting

* Expertise in business research and product management including data analysis, requirement gathering and use case development

* Demonstrated ability to translate business vision into defined and prioritized stories for the team backlog

* Experience with Jira or similar Agile backlog management tool preferred

* Ability to think broadly – while the focus may be on a specific product line – you possess the ability to think of the customer’s total relationship with Fidelity

* Maturity to work across business units and senior leaders to evolve roadmaps and prioritization of product features

* Demonstrated dedication to cross-functional collaboration in Agile, client-centric, dynamic environment with a true passion for “test and learn”

**The Value You Deliver**

* Ability to manage a set of enterprise initiatives including traditional Brokerage services & Crypto Trading

* Managing expectations with cross-functional and enterprise leadership teams – including business research, finance, legal and technology.

* Delivery responsibility of various initiatives within Green Meadows Order Management

* Cross BU collaboration at Senior levels – Product Area leader level

* Ability to synthesize requirements and business needs into platform features

* Assist team with prioritizing features, backlog and oversight of the JIRA board

* Staying close to the customer, and understanding customer needs

* Synthesizing complex data from multiple, disparate sources and present analysis, relevant insights and themes in a simple/clear way

* Having a strong affinity for business analysis, secondary research, and operational improvement work

**The Skills You Bring**

*Your ability to deliver customer value and business results on the squad by:*

* Complete end-to-end product management

* Experience and Insights into financial products, their setup, attributes, lifecycle and customer base

* Solid experience with analysis, agile project management

* Cross product area understanding of brokerage and crypto domains

* Pulling information together across a diverse set of individuals and teams, and articulating the full story across multiple streams of work

* Positive relationship, communications, and presentation skills

* Motivated individual with ability to think, work, multi-task, influence, act independently, and maintains a positive can-do attitude

*Your knowledge as a subject matter expert in the following areas:*

* Application of Financial Services, Brokerage Operations & Trade Processing to address client’s needs, wants and preferences

* Strong knowledge of Order management & Regulatory Reporting

* Business insight, along with your strategic and analytical skills that allows you to make decisions and build stories based on both hard and soft data

* Active participation in defining requirements and writing stories to help inform product strategy, enhancements, and process improvements

* Experience working in Agile environment and with Agile methodology

*Your ability to identify client needs and wants by:*

* Participating in the prioritization of the team work (in partnership with Technology leaders& Business operations leaders) to deliver customer value based on an understanding of business subject matter areas and client needs

* Possessing strong skills in JIRA, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.

The base salary range for this position is $85,000-$179,000 per year.

Placement in the range will vary based on job responsibilities and scope, geographic location, candidate’s relevant experience, and other factors.

Base salary is only part of the total compensation package. Depending on the position and eligibility requirements, the offer package may also include bonus or other variable compensation.

We offer a wide range of benefits to meet your evolving needs and help you live your best life at work and at home. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage and emotional well-being support, market-leading retirement, generous paid time off and parental leave, charitable giving employee match program, and educational assistance including student loan repayment, tuition reimbursement, and learning resources to develop your career. Note, the application window closes when the position is filled or unposted.

Please be advised that Fidelity’s business is governed by the provisions of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Investment Advisers Act of 1940, the Investment Company Act of 1940, ERISA, numerous state laws governing securities, investment and retirement-related financial activities and the rules and regulations of numerous self-regulatory organizations, including FINRA, among others. Those laws and regulations may restrict Fidelity from hiring and/or associating with individuals with certain Criminal Histories.

Fidelity’s hybrid working model blends the best of both onsite and offsite work experiences. Working onsite is important for our business strategy and our culture. We also value the benefits that working offsite offers associates. Most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite every other week (all business days, M-F) in a Fidelity office.

### **Certifications:**

### **Category:**

Information Technology
company_description: At Fidelity Investments, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours.

title: Analyst Scheduling (Copper)
description:
**Analyst Scheduling (Copper)**

* **An exciting career with a global company**
* **Be part of our Sales & Operations Planning team, a critical pillar in our commercial business!**
* **Permanent role, based in Chicago IL, United States**

**About the role**

**Finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs.**

We are looking for an Analyst to assist in development and execution of the sales & operations planning (S&OP) process, which will deliver superior value across the value chain of our US-based copper business.

This role is a great opportunity for a developing techno-commercial practitioner who is interested in driving commercial value through operational and supply chain excellence.

Reporting to the **Manager Integrated Sales Operations** you will:

* Work closely with Sales, Logistics and Operations teams to optimise margin through schedule and contract decisions.
* Contribute to improvement in scheduling processes and customer satisfaction.
* Provide insights into risks and opportunities, focusing on the 0–2-month period.
* Actively participate in improving our technology and data solutions.
* Assist with operational reporting and visualisations to enhance decision making.
* Support existing sales and customer service as well as new business development.

**About you**

**To be successfully considered for this role, you will have:**

* University degree in either Business, Engineering, Logistics, Marketing or related fields.
* Experience in commercial aspects of commodity marketing/trading and/or supply chain.
* Analytical thinking, problem solving and decision making.
* Ability to work in multi-functional teams and deliver measurable outcomes.
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with stakeholders at various levels of the organization.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, or R.
* Familiarity with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems like SAP or Oracle.
* Additional knowledge or certifications related to the copper market or mining operations.

**It will also be beneficial if you have:**

* Prior experience with S&OP, supply chain and/or demand planning
* Experience in copper industry or commodities / mining

**Where you will be working**

The Commercial group is focused on maximizing the value of our products, growing value in the marketplace through partnership with the company’s customers, suppliers, product groups and Group functions. Headquartered in Singapore, and integrated with Rio Tinto’s assets, hubs, and offices globally, the Commercial group provides the commercial insights to drive value along the mine-to-market value chain.

The Commercial group incorporates and uses the knowledge and capabilities of our global Sales & Marketing, Procurement, and Marine & Logistics organisations, supported by the Market Analysis, Commercial Treasury and other functions, to ensure our approach to business is driven by a commercially astute and innovative mind-set.

#LI-Hybrid

**About Rio Tinto**  
  
Rio Tinto is a leading global mining and materials company. We operate in 35 countries where we produce iron ore, copper, aluminium, critical minerals, and other materials needed for the global energy transition and for people, communities, and nations to thrive.  
  
We have been mining for 150 years and operate with knowledge built up across generations and continents. Our purpose is finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs – striving for innovation and continuous improvement to produce materials with low emissions and to the right environmental, social and governance standards. But we can’t do it on our own, so we’re focused on creating partnerships to solve problems, create win-win situations and meet opportunities.

**Every Voice Matters**

Rio Tinto is committed to equal employment opportunity. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel safe, respected and valued. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome but are essential to our success. We treat all our people fairly and with dignity.

Rio Tinto participates in E- Verify to confirm work authorization. Please visit http://www.ucis.gov/ for more information.

company_description: Finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Amphenol Communications Solutions (ACS), a division of Amphenol Corporation, is a world leader in interconnect solutions for Communications, Mobile, RF, Optics, and Commercial electronics markets. Amphenol Corporation is one of the world’s largest designers and manufacturers of electrical, electronic and fiber optic connectors and interconnect systems, antennas, sensors and sensor-based products and coaxial and high-speed specialty cable. ACS has an expansive global presence in research and development, manufacturing, and sales. We design and manufacture a wide range of innovative connectors as well as cable assemblies for diverse applications including server, storage, data center, mobile, RF, networking, industrial, business equipment, and automotive.

**Position:** **Data Analyst**

**Location:** **Valley Green, PA (Harrisburg Area)**

Amphenol High Speed Products Group is the market leader for high speed, high bandwidth electrical connectors for the Telecom/Datacom market (Mobile Networks, Storage, Servers, Routers, Switches, etc.). Our products help to enable the electronics revolution and remain a key enabler for all the major Tier 1 OEMs globally. We have design, sales, and manufacturing locations globally and are currently seeking a Data Analyst to join our Cable Backplane Systems team located in Etters, PA.

The ideal candidate will have a solid background in data analytics, statistical analysis, and data reporting. The primary responsibilities include gathering and analyzing data to support business decisions and factory optimization.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Data Collection and Cleaning: Gather data from various sources and ensure its accuracy and completeness.
* Data Analysis: Use statistical techniques and software tools to analyze data and identify trends, patterns, and insights.
* Reporting: Create reports and visualizations to present findings to stakeholders, including executives and team members.
* Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that support their goals.
* Database Management: Design and maintain databases and data systems to ensure data integrity and accessibility.
* Performance Monitoring: Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of business decisions.
* Manage and maintain SharePoint sites to ensure effective collaboration and information sharing.
* Ensure data integrity and accuracy by performing regular data quality checks.
* Automate data collection and reporting processes to improve efficiency.
* Stay up to date with the latest industry trends and best practices in data analytics and visualization.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Bachelor’s degree in statistics, data science, or a related field required. MS preferred.
* 2+ years' experience in data analysis, data engineering, or a related field
* Experience with statistical programs such as JMP or MiniTAB
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to interpret complex data sets.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively present findings to non-technical stakeholders.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Amphenol Corporation is proud of our reputation as an excellent employer. Our main focus is to provide the highest level of support and responsiveness to both our employees and our customers, the world's largest technology companies. Amphenol Corporation offers the opportunity for career growth within a global organization. We believe that Amphenol Corporation is unique in that every employee, regardless of his or her position, has the ability to positively impact the business.

Amphenol is an “Equal Opportunity Employer” - Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin

For additional company information please visit our website at https://www.amphenol-cs.com/
company_description: Amphenol Canada Corp. has been an international leader in the design and production of Interconnect Products for more than 50 years.

title: Supply Chain Analyst-Onsite
description:
Job Responsibilities:

* Checks and validates sales order data meticulously upon its receipt to guarantee accuracy and completeness, ensuring that all necessary information is present and correct.
* Adds relevant data and information and meticulously enters the order details into the computer system, enabling the determination of the delivery date with precision and efficiency.
* Provides prompt confirmation of the order to the customer, effectively communicating the confirmed delivery date to ensure clarity and transparency in the transaction.
* Engages in diligent monitoring of the sales order flow, with a keen focus on managing any exceptions that may arise, promptly addressing issues to maintain smooth operations.
* Collaborates actively with internal departments to discuss and resolve any discrepancies or uncertainties, contributing to the maintenance of clean and accurate sales order records.
* Maintains continuous oversight of sales orders throughout the entire process, from creation to delivery and invoicing, ensuring seamless progression and timely completion.
* Generates comprehensive monthly reports on order receipt, providing valuable insights and data to support informed decision-making and process improvement initiatives.
* Executes various tasks, including the creation of approved product returns orders, processing credits and debits, and facilitating the exchange of information with internal stakeholders regarding any changes or updates to delivery times.

  

Minimum required Education: High School Diploma, Vocational Education.

Preferred Skills: Supply Chain Management (SCM) Troubleshooting Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Systems Order Management Software Data Analysis & Interpretation Data Management Documentation & Reporting Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Software Order Fulfillment

Benefits:
  
Paid sick leave, Medical/Dental (optional), 401 (k) Retirement Plan (optional), Employer Paid Life Insurance, Employer Paid Short Term Disability, Optional Life Insurance.

ELYON International, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Data Engineer I - Bond & Specialty Insurance
description:
**Who Are We?**

Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That’s the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.

**Compensation Overview**

The annual base salary range provided for this position is a nationwide market range and represents a broad range of salaries for this role across the country. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. As part of our comprehensive compensation and benefits program, employees are also eligible for performance-based cash incentive awards.

**Salary Range**

$106,300.00 - $175,400.00

**Target Openings**

1

**What Is the Opportunity?**

The Bond and Specialty Insurance (BSI) Business Insights and Analytics (BI&A) Technical Business Analyst (Tech BA) team focuses on supporting the organization's data infrastructure and analytics initiatives. This position involves working closely with business partners, senior data engineers and cross-functional teams to assist in the design, development, and maintenance of data pipelines and systems. The Data Engineer 1 will be responsible for data requirements, perform data analysis to reverse engineer existing systems, ensure data quality and integrity, perform data extraction, profiling, and transformation tasks, and contribute to the optimization of data workflows. Additionally, this role will involve learning and applying best practices in data management and governance, gaining proficiency in cloud-based and on-premises data technologies, and leveraging AI to streamline processes and enhance productivity. The ideal candidate will have a foundational understanding of programming languages such as Python or SQL, a keen interest in data engineering, and a willingness to learn and grow within a dynamic and collaborative environment. We are on a multi-year, multi-million journey to migrate to the cloud version of Guidewire’s PolicyCenter. Our team will follow architecture patterns to seamlessly merge our legacy on-premises data with the new cloud infrastructure, while minimizing impact on our data consumers.

**What Will You Do?**

* Build and operationalize complex data solutions, correct problems, apply transformations, and recommend data cleansing/quality solutions.
* Design data solutions.
* Analyze sources to determine value and recommend data to include in analytical processes.
* Incorporate core data management competencies including data governance, data security and data quality.
* Collaborate within and across teams to support delivery and educate end users on data products/analytic environment.
* Perform data and system analysis, assessment and resolution for defects and incidents of moderate complexity and correct as appropriate.
* Test data movement, transformation code, and data components.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**What Will Our Ideal Candidate Have?**

* Bachelor’s Degree in STEM related field or equivalent
* Six years of related experience
* Proficient use of tools, techniques, and manipulation including Cloud platforms, programming languages, and an understanding of software engineering practices.
* The ability to deliver work at a steady, predictable pace to achieve commitments, decompose work assignments into small batch releases, and contribute to tradeoff and negotiation discussions.
* Demonstrated track record of domain expertise including the ability to understand technical concepts and possess in-depth knowledge of immediate systems worked on.
* Proven problem solving skills including debugging skills, allowing you to determine source of issues in unfamiliar code or systems and the ability to recognize and solve repetitive problems.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact with team members and business partners.
* Leadership - Intermediate leadership skills with a proven track record of self-motivation in identifying personal growth opportunities.

**What is a Must Have?**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent training with data tools, techniques, and manipulation.
* Four years of data engineering or equivalent experience.

**What Is in It for You?**

* **Health Insurance**: Employees and their eligible family members – including spouses, domestic partners, and children – are eligible for coverage from the first day of employment.
* **Retirement:** Travelers matches your 401(k) contributions dollar-for-dollar up to your first 5% of eligible pay, subject to an annual maximum. If you have student loan debt, you can enroll in the Paying it Forward Savings Program. When you make a payment toward your student loan, Travelers will make an annual contribution into your 401(k) account. You are also eligible for a Pension Plan that is 100% funded by Travelers.
* **Paid Time Off:** Start your career at Travelers with a minimum of 20 days Paid Time Off annually, plus nine paid company Holidays.
* **Wellness Program:** The Travelers wellness program is comprised of tools, discounts and resources that empower you to achieve your wellness goals and caregiving needs. In addition, our mental health program provides access to free professional counseling services, health coaching and other resources to support your daily life needs.
* **Volunteer Encouragement:** We have a deep commitment to the communities we serve and encourage our employees to get involved. Travelers has a Matching Gift and Volunteer Rewards program that enables you to give back to the charity of your choice.

**Employment Practices**

Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We value the unique abilities and talents each individual brings to our organization and recognize that we benefit in numerous ways from our differences.

In accordance with local law, candidates seeking employment in Colorado are not required to disclose dates of attendance at or graduation from educational institutions.

If you are a candidate and have specific questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an email so we may assist you.

Travelers reserves the right to fill this position at a level above or below the level included in this posting.

To learn more about our comprehensive benefit programs please visit http://careers.travelers.com/life-at-travelers/benefits/.

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) for ABA Software Product
description:
**About Artemis ABA Inc.:**  
Artemis ABA Inc. is a technology company revolutionizing the ABA field through our proprietary, AI-powered platform—built entirely on Salesforce—streamlines clinical workflows, billing, scheduling, and compliance. Designed with ABA professionals in mind, Artemis delivers intuitive, scalable solutions that power smarter care delivery and operational excellence.

**Job Summary:**  
As a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) at Artemis ABA, you will serve as a clinical subject matter expert for Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) and collaborate closely with clients, leadership, sales, and product teams. This is a unique opportunity to influence innovation in the ABA space, help shape the product roadmap, and work directly with technologists to deliver cutting-edge ABA solutions.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for clinical and practice management aspects of the Artemis ABA software platform.
* Evaluate current product functionality, identify clinical gaps, and communicate enhancement insights to technical and business leadership.
* Review and validate customer requirements and help prioritize them on the product roadmap.
* Participate in product demonstrations for prospective and existing clients as needed.
* Present and promote Artemis ABA products to customers and BCBAs, acting as a trusted SME.
* Support implementation and customer success teams during onboarding and ongoing client engagement.
* Represent Artemis ABA through speaking opportunities and authored content in coordination with the marketing team.
* Develop deep product knowledge to align with client and market needs.
* Identify and evaluate new product opportunities based on client and sales team interactions.
* Collaborate with internal teams to define, manage, and communicate the product roadmap.
* Advocate for product capabilities both internally (leadership, sales, client success) and externally (clients, partners).
* Contribute to business case development for new product features and innovation initiatives.
* Work closely with development to translate and prioritize product feature requests.

Mandatory Skills:

* Active BCBA Certification

Preferred Experience:

* Experience working with ABA software or practice management platforms.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to present complex ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional, fast-paced team.
* Passion for technology and improving the delivery of ABA services.

title: FP&A Analyst
description:
KOST USA, a member of the Recochem family, has been in business since 1985. KOST USA is a leading producer of antifreeze and functional fluids in the United States. While Recochem is a Canadian based organization, KOST USA is located out of Cincinnati, OH.
  
  
Together with KOST, Recochem is continuously working to promote and develop sustainable solutions to exceed customer expectations. Recochem supports a diverse line of solutions including coolant/antifreeze, EV thermal fluids, performance fluids, diesel exhaust fluid, windshield washer fluids, car care, rust preventatives, household solvents & winterizing solutions.
  
  
Recochem excels at turning consumer insights into innovation while driving In-depth category expertise and building power brands that align to consumer preference. Our innovative solutions are backed by R&D expertise and next-level education. Our progressive supply chain is unmatched, with 16 manufacturing facilities across the globe.
  
  
KOST USA is looking for an FP&A Analyst to join our team. We are looking for a self-motivated, professional, and organized individual who enjoys detailed work and a fast-paced environment. The FP&A Analyst is responsible for working across the organization to ensure accurate recording of inventory, proper product costing, process improvement, management reporting and assisting in financial planning.
  
  
**In this position, you will be responsible for:**  
Maintaining the inventory module and related entries and reconciliations, including reconciling cycle counts from the Operations team to financial records for all locations and all products.
  
Maintaining accurate and up-to-date bills of materials for all products and SKUs.
  
Preparing inventory related management reports, key metrics and trend summaries. Creating visibility of cost of sales and gross margin results for the management team.
  
Partnering with the Site Controller and management team to reduce inventory levels and identify aging inventory and recommended actions.
  
Collaborating with operating personnel to ensure timely and accurate cycle counting program.
  
Developing and maintaining financial models to support budgeting, forecasting, and long-term planning.
  
Conducting variance analysis to compare actual results to budget and forecast, identifying key drivers and trends.
  
Supporting the Site Controller with the plant’s financial and capital budgeting process.
  
Providing financial insights and recommendations to support strategic decision-making.
  
Periodically reviewing absorption methodology and recommending new approaches to ensure proper costing and minimizing variability.
  
Other duties as assigned.
  
  
**Required Experience:**  
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other business-related field. Or other relevant experience.
  
Five or more years of experience
  
Preferred background in manufacturing/distribution and support of operational performance
  
Must have strong finance conceptual knowledge and analytical mindset, strong communication skills, and work well in a team environment
  
Advanced Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
  
SQL experience is a plus but not required.
  
Experience using integrated ERP systems, Microsoft AX or Dynamics 365 experience is a plus
  
  
**What we have to offer:**  

* Competitive pay!
* Opportunities for advancement – we prioritize promoting from within
* Generous 401k match up to 3.5%
* Health, Dental, and Vision insurance
* PTO + up to 10 paid holidays

Pre-employment background (criminal and drug) check required.
  
KOST USA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer of Minorities, Females, Veterans, and Disabled individuals.

KOST USA, a member of the Recochem family, has been in business since 1985. KOST USA is a leading producer of antifreeze and functional fluids in the United States. While Recochem is a Canadian based organization, KOST USA is located out of Cincinnati, OH.
  
  
Together with KOST, Recochem is continuously working to promote and develop sustainable solutions to exceed customer expectations. Recochem supports a diverse line of solutions including coolant/antifreeze, EV thermal fluids, performance fluids, diesel exhaust fluid, windshield washer fluids, car care, rust preventatives, household solvents & winterizing solutions.
  
  
Recochem excels at turning consumer insights into innovation while driving In-depth category expertise and building power brands that align to consumer preference. Our innovative solutions are backed by R&D expertise and next-level education. Our progressive supply chain is unmatched, with 16 manufacturing facilities across the globe.
  
  
KOST USA is looking for an FP&A Analyst to join our team. We are looking for a self-motivated, professional, and organized individual who enjoys detailed work and a fast-paced environment. The FP&A Analyst is responsible for working across the organization to ensure accurate recording of inventory, proper product costing, process improvement, management reporting and assisting in financial planning.
  
  
**In this position, you will be responsible for:**  
Maintaining the inventory module and related entries and reconciliations, including reconciling cycle counts from the Operations team to financial records for all locations and all products.
  
Maintaining accurate and up-to-date bills of materials for all products and SKUs.
  
Preparing inventory related management reports, key metrics and trend summaries. Creating visibility of cost of sales and gross margin results for the management team.
  
Partnering with the Site Controller and management team to reduce inventory levels and identify aging inventory and recommended actions.
  
Collaborating with operating personnel to ensure timely and accurate cycle counting program.
  
Developing and maintaining financial models to support budgeting, forecasting, and long-term planning.
  
Conducting variance analysis to compare actual results to budget and forecast, identifying key drivers and trends.
  
Supporting the Site Controller with the plant’s financial and capital budgeting process.
  
Providing financial insights and recommendations to support strategic decision-making.
  
Periodically reviewing absorption methodology and recommending new approaches to ensure proper costing and minimizing variability.
  
Other duties as assigned.
  
  
**Required Experience:**  
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other business-related field. Or other relevant experience.
  
Five or more years of experience
  
Preferred background in manufacturing/distribution and support of operational performance
  
Must have strong finance conceptual knowledge and analytical mindset, strong communication skills, and work well in a team environment
  
Advanced Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
  
SQL experience is a plus but not required.
  
Experience using integrated ERP systems, Microsoft AX or Dynamics 365 experience is a plus
  
  
**What we have to offer:**  

* Competitive pay!
* Opportunities for advancement – we prioritize promoting from within
* Generous 401k match up to 3.5%
* Health, Dental, and Vision insurance
* PTO + up to 10 paid holidays

Pre-employment background (criminal and drug) check required.
  
KOST USA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer of Minorities, Females, Veterans, and Disabled individuals.

title: Assessment Implementation Analyst
description:
At Curriculum Associates, we believe in the potential of every child and are changing the face of education technology with award-winning learning programs like i-Ready that serve a third of the nation’s K–8 students. For more than 50 years, our commitment to making classrooms better places, serving educators, and supporting accessible learning experiences for all students has driven the continuous improvement of our innovative programs. Our team of more than 2,500 employees is composed of lifelong learners who stand behind this mission, working tirelessly to serve the educational community with world-class programs and support every day.

As an Assessment Implementation Analyst, team members use analytical, technical, and organizational skills to create reports that help district and school leaders gain insight into the performance and growth of their students. With guidance from senior implementation leaders, the Assessment Implementation Analyst extracts data from various sources and uses advanced Excel skills to create reports and visualizations in support of educators’ informed decision making.

The impact you'll have:

* Support Curriculum Associates’ programs focused on building the capacity of district and school leaders to use data to drive decisions that improve and sustain student achievement.
* Use advanced Excel skills to develop reports that efficiently combine, aggregate and summarize student data metrics to derive insights.
* Design and create clear and compelling tables and visualizations in Excel to illustrate data trends.
* Develop SQL queries to efficiently extract and aggregate data from large relational databases.
* Write clear, user-friendly documentation and instructions for end users.
* Create and maintain technical documentation for analytic procedures in tools like Confluence and GitHub.
* Develop and maintain an understanding of Curriculum Associates’ product offerings.
* Manage multiple tasks while maintaining a high level of attention to detail.

Who we're looking for:

* Excellent problem solving and analytical capability.
* Exceptional Excel skills, with the ability to demonstrate mastery of advanced lookups, functions and formulas, macros, complex data analysis tools, PivotTables, Power Pivot etc.
* Applied experience with Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is a plus.
* Experience with SQL coding skills and querying from large relational databases is a plus.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ideally with experience communicating complex technical topics to lay audiences.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities as needs shift or customer issues arise.
* Excellent interpersonal skills, with a focus on collaboration and teamwork.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks with competing timelines.

* Commitment to improving the learning of all students through research-based practices.

Required Education and Experience:

* Bachelor’s degree and at least two years of applied experience in generating complex reports in Excel using large datasets, or a combination of education and experience in a related field that proves competency in the requirements of the job.
* Applied experience in the management and reporting of K-12 student data is a plus.
* Especially well qualified candidates will also have experience in the field of education and knowledge of educational measurement principles, including familiarity with psychometric concepts such as measurement error, validity, and reliability estimation.
* Must be able to provide writing samples and be willing to complete an analytic performance task.

Travel: Approximately 10%, primarily to company offices and team meetings.

Benefits and Pay Range:  
Pay Range – This role’s range is $60,750-$99,750. The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that Curriculum Associates considers in making compensation decisions based on our Compensation Philosophy. Actual base pay within that range will vary based upon several factors including, but not limited to, prior experience and relevant skill sets. At Curriculum Associates, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances for each case. This role is also eligible to participate in the company bonus plan. The Company recognizes that minimum wage varies by location and will ensure all compensation decisions comply with applicable state and local laws.

Benefits – Benefit eligible employees (and their families) are covered by medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. Employees can enroll in our company’s 401k plan and receive an employer match. Employees have access to a flexible vacation and sick policy in addition to twelve paid holidays and a winter office closure between Christmas and New Year's, as well as a number of additional perks and benefits.

  

*Curriculum Associates, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Curriculum Associates will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based on any legally-recognized basis, including, but not limited to: race (including ancestry, national origin, ethnic characteristics, interracial marriage or association, and traits historically associated with race such as hair texture and protective hairstyles), color, religion and creed (including all aspects of religious observance, practice and belief), sex (including pregnancy, lactation, childbirth or related medical conditions, breastfeeding, sex assigned at birth, difference of sex development and variations of sex characteristics), affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, citizenship or immigration status, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including testing and characteristics), veteran or uniformed servicemember status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.*

*If you need special assistance or an accommodation for a disability in order to apply for a posted position, please contact our People and Culture department at* 

*people@cainc.com*

 *for US based job postings. Contact* 

*people-india@cainc.com*

 *for India job postings.*

*US-based Candidates:*

*Curriculum Associates uses E-Verify to confirm the employment eligibility of all newly hired employees. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, please visit:* 

*https://www.e-verify.gov/employees/employee-rights-and-responsibilities*

*Information that you provide when applying for employment with Curriculum Associates, LLC may be subject to the California Privacy Rights Act.*

title: Analyst Scheduling (Copper)
description:
**Analyst Scheduling (Copper)**

* **An exciting career with a global company**
* **Be part of our Sales & Operations Planning team, a critical pillar in our commercial business!**
* **Permanent role, based in Chicago IL, United States**

**About the role**

**Finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs.**

We are looking for an Analyst to assist in development and execution of the sales & operations planning (S&OP) process, which will deliver superior value across the value chain of our US-based copper business.

This role is a great opportunity for a developing techno-commercial practitioner who is interested in driving commercial value through operational and supply chain excellence.

Reporting to the **Manager Integrated Sales Operations** you will:

* Work closely with Sales, Logistics and Operations teams to optimise margin through schedule and contract decisions.
* Contribute to improvement in scheduling processes and customer satisfaction.
* Provide insights into risks and opportunities, focusing on the 0–2-month period.
* Actively participate in improving our technology and data solutions.
* Assist with operational reporting and visualisations to enhance decision making.
* Support existing sales and customer service as well as new business development.

**About you**

**To be successfully considered for this role,**

  

Rio Tinto is a leading global mining and materials company. We operate in 35 countries where we produce iron ore, copper, aluminum, critical minerals, and other materials needed for the global energy transition and for people, communities, and nations to thrive.

We have been mining for 150 years and operate with knowledge built up across generations and continents. Our purpose is finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs—striving for innovation and continuous improvement to produce materials with low emissions and to the right environmental, social and governance standards. But we can’t do it on our own, so we’re focused on creating partnerships to solve problems, create win-win and meet opportunities.

  

Rio Tinto is committed to equal employment opportunity. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel safe, respected and valued. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome but are essential to our success. We treat all our people fairly and with dignity.

Rio Tinto participates in E- Verify to confirm work authorization. Please visit http://www.ucis.gov/ for more information.

  

Where can Rio Tinto take you?

You’re passionate and ambitious with tremendous career aspirations. The breadth and growth of our organisation empowers you to define your ideal career path.

### **Take a look at Shona’s career journey**

* **2022 – Present**

  **General Manager Weipa Operations**

  Weipa, Far North Queensland, Australia

  **General Manager Bell Bay Aluminium**

  Launceston, Tasmania, Australia

  Gladstone, Queensland, Australia

  Gladstone, Queensland, Australia

  **Services department Manager Boyne Smelters**

  Gladstone, Queensland, Australia

  **Manager Health, Safety, Environment and business improvement Boyne Smelters**

  Gladstone, Queensland, Australia

  **Lean Six Sigma Black Belt – Boyne Smelters**

  Gladstone, Queensland, Australia
* **2009**

  **Operations Superintendent**

  Gladstone, Queensland, Australia
* **2005**

  **Operations Superintendent**

  Launceston, Tasmania, Australia
* **2004**

  **Graduate Engineer**

  Launceston, Tasmania, Australia

Working in a technical role at Rio Tinto

Your advanced expertise will help drive human progress.

We’ve developed technical capabilities through nearly 150 years of discovering, planning, and operating mines in every corner of the world. We’re an open, connected international team of technical specialists using some of the most sophisticated tools and robust data on the planet. Join us and experience:

Inclusion & diversity

Previous

### **A commitment to inclusion and diversity**

We’re committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable being themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity and value our differences for the strength and diversity they bring to our organisation.

### **Inspiring people and an empowering culture**

Whatever our individual roles, we’re each here to contribute to extremely important work. And we do it together. We inspire, encourage, empower and truly care for each other as we live out the values and deliver the performance that defines Rio Tinto.

### **Meaningful work**

You’ll be joining a global technical community with the best tools and data at your fingertips. We are innovation leaders and are committed to advancing the promise of a more sustainable world. Nothing could be more rewarding.

### **Quality of life**

### **Opportunities for growth**

With a business as expansive and diverse as ours, the opportunities for professional advancement are limitless. Our technical development programs are industry-leading and enable you to grow your career through a dedicated technical path while being rewarded for your unique skills.

Whatever our individual roles, we’re each here to contribute to extremely important work. And we do it together. We inspire, encourage, empower and truly care for each other as we live out the values and deliver the performance that defines Rio Tinto.

Our application process

**01**

### **Apply**

The first thing you’ll need to do is apply to the role. You can do this with your LinkedIn profile or you can upload your resume. We’ll also ask you to complete a few questions before you submit your application.

**02**

### **Undergo assessments**

Our assessments are designed to help us work out whether you are suitable for the role. We will let you know which ones you’ll need to complete.

**03**

Our interviews could be in person or online. It’s a great opportunity for us to get to know you a bit better, answer any of your questions and talk about the exciting career opportunity you have applied for.

**04**

At this stage, we will let you know if you have been successful. If you have been, we’ll need to conduct a couple of checks, such as a background or security check. You may also need to do a medical assessment depending on the role you have applied for.

**05**

### **Join the Rio Tinto team**

title: Sr Manager Category Management
description:
Foods you love. Brands you trust. And a career that empowers you to grow.  
  
At Nestlé USA, we’re all working towards the same goal – to delight and deliver for our consumers. With a rich portfolio of beloved brands, including DiGiorno, Toll House, and Coffee mate, in 97% of U.S. households, we have a unique opportunity – and responsibility – to be there for every moment in our consumers’ lives.

Joining Nestlé means becoming part of an inclusive workplace that inspires innovation, encourages strategic thinking and creativity, and celebrates your achievements. No matter where you work within the organization, you are empowered to challenge the status quo, embrace risk-taking, and pioneer new ideas. Our supportive and collaborative environment encourages bold ambitions and continuous learning so that everyone can grow and thrive.  
  
*This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship.*

Nestlé USA’s Coffee & Beverage Division is on a mission to craft cups that uplift our consumers and better our communities. With brands like Starbucks, Coffee-Mate, Nescafé, Nesquik, Natural Bliss, Seattle’s Best Coffee and Blue Bottle, our diverse product portfolio is brimming with rich and fulfilling opportunities for motivated individuals. Our offices provide an inspiring and high-energy work environment that fuels our fast-paced growth, and our field-based positions across the country ensure that we are fully immersed and positioned to pioneer the coffee and beverage market. Across our organization, we are creating a workplace where collaboration is essential, courage is rewarded, speed is expected, and agility is the norm in order to delight our consumers and shoppers every single day. Together, we will elevate everyday moments with each sip.

**Main Purpose of Job**  
The **Senior Category Leadership Manager (Advisor)** plays a crucial role in developing and executing the customer’s OMNI category strategic plan. This position is responsible for leading a team of Managers and Category Analysts focused on Category Advisorships, providing coaching and guidance to enhance their strategic thinking and drive category growth, as well as ensuring effective execution of the modular relay draw.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead and manage the Category Advisorship team, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives and strategic initiatives.
* Mentor and develop team members in category management principles to enhance their skills and effectiveness.
* Proactively evaluate customer business needs while guiding the team in delivering actionable reporting, insights, and market analysis to support customer decision-making.
* Oversee the development of OMNI Strategic Category plans in collaboration with customers to drive growth.
* Provide coaching on leveraging insights technology to uncover customer-specific category insights that support the modular relay strategy and execution processes.
* Foster internal relationships to gather customer-specific insights and drive project initiatives while effectively managing budgetary needs for insights and additional tools
* Ownership of team member 1:1 meetings, performance management, and related managerial responsibilities, as well as coaching, weekly priorities and project management

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree preferred
* Professional category advisor experience on the Walmart account is required
* Direct management of a team of category professionals required, with an ability to lead, train and develop others
* Detailed knowledge and experience with the Walmart Modular processes and how to drive category growth through strategic thought leadership

**Technical Skills**

* Scintilla
* Circana/Nielsen
* JDA Space Planning (ProSpace)
* CKB, POG Generator
* Power BI/Tableau
* Excel, PowerPoint

77046461

It is our business imperative to remain a very inclusive workplace.  
  
To our veterans and separated service members, you're at the forefront of our minds as we recruit top talent to join Nestlé. The skills you've gained while serving our country, such as flexibility, agility, and leadership, are much like the skills that will make you successful in this role. In addition, with our commitment to an inclusive work environment, we recognize the exceptional engagement and innovation displayed by individuals with disabilities. Nestlé seeks such skilled and qualified individuals to share our mission where you’ll join a cohort of others who have chosen to call Nestlé home.

The Nestlé Companies are equal employment opportunity employers. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Prior to the next step in the recruiting process, we welcome you to inform us confidentially if you may require any special accommodations in order to participate fully in our recruitment experience. Contact us at accommodations@nestle.com or please dial 711 and provide this number to the operator: 1-800-321-6467.

This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship.

Review our applicant privacy notice before applying at https://www.nestlejobs.com/privacy.

title: Order Management Analyst
description:
TrueCar is a leading automotive digital marketplace, and we are on a mission to make car buying and selling easy, transparent, and efficient. We work to empower consumers with data and foster connections with our network of Certified Dealers who share our belief that truth, transparency, and fairness are the foundation of a great experience. We forge partnerships to power car-buying programs for some of America’s most trusted brands. And we continually innovate to provide useful tools, research, market context, and pricing transparency to help consumers feel empowered and confident throughout their journey.

As consumers’ priorities and shopping habits shifted, so did we. We are building a modern-day marketplace and invite you to join the TrueCar Crew. You can have a real and direct impact on our journey as we continue to evolve and revolutionize the car-buying and selling experience.

**The Opportunity:**

We are looking for a strategic and detail-oriented e-commerce Order Management Analyst to lead the TrueCar+ order management function and oversee the end-to-end order lifecycle. Reporting to the Director of Consumer & Dealer Experience, you will be responsible for driving operational excellence, **starting as an individual contributor and then ultimately managing a team,** interfacing with cross-functional stakeholders while ensuring order fulfillment aligns with company goals and customer expectations. This role requires a strong focus on order analysis to ensure operational efficiency, forecast demand, identify bottlenecks, and enhance customer satisfaction.

You’ll need a balance of hands-on order management expertise, process optimization, data-driven decision-making, strong analytics and reporting capability, and leadership.

### **How you will contribute to TrueCar’s success:**

**Strategic Leadership & Oversight:** Lead and oversee the e-commerce order management function, serving as the subject matter expert for systems, policies, and processes. Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Operations, Support, Engineering, and third-party vendors to streamline the order-to-fulfillment process and resolve operational roadblocks.

**Process Optimization & System Enhancement:** Develop, implement, and optimize order management workflows, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and best practices. Lead or support system enhancements, User Acceptance Testing (UAT), integrations, and digital transformation initiatives related to ERP and CRM platforms.

**Performance Monitoring & Analysis:** Own and track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to order accuracy, fulfillment lead times, backlog, and customer satisfaction. Monitor order patterns for anomalies and trends, analyze order cycle times to identify and address delays, and analyze order accuracy rates and exceptions to implement systemic fixes. Define and track metrics like Order Fill Rate and Perfect Order Rate, creating automated dashboards for executive decision-making.

**Issue Resolution & Customer Experience:** Manage escalations and complex order scenarios, including financial issues, dealership support, technical support, last-mile delivery, titling and registration, and special customer requests. Analyze service level agreement (SLA) adherence and order-related complaints to provide insights that improve customer experience.

**Data-Driven Insights & Reporting:** Develop and integrate real-time and historical order data into forecasting models, supporting sales and inventory planning. Provide regular reporting and strategic insights to senior leadership on order trends, operational bottlenecks, revenue implications, and cost-benefit analyses for system/process upgrades.

**Mentorship & Development:** Mentor and develop junior analysts or coordinators, fostering a culture of accountability and continuous improvement.

### **Your Expertise:**

Demonstrated success in order management, supply chain operations, or sales operations, with experience in a leadership or supervisory role.

Proven experience in a fast-paced, high-volume manufacturing, retail, or e-commerce environment.

Advanced proficiency in ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, NetSuite) and CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce).

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; ability to derive insights from data and act strategically.

Proficiency in data visualization or BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).

Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

Experience working in a complex B2B and B2C environment is preferred.

Familiarity with auto-industry trade terms, operations, compliance, and logistics coordination is preferred.

Project management experience is preferred.

Experience leading process improvement initiatives (e.g., Lean, Six Sigma, Agile methodologies) is preferred.

Base salary range: $80,000 - $90,000

**Your TrueCar Experience**

As a crew member, you’ll be primarily based out of your home as a part of our Dynamic Workplace strategy. We provide additional benefits & perks to assist our crew members in having a sustainable home workstation, including monthly internet/mobile phone service reimbursement and furniture & equipment for your space.

You will receive excellent benefits that include, but aren’t limited to, 100% employer-paid health/vision/dental premiums, 401 (k) with company contribution, equity, a wellness stipend program, and a learning & development reimbursement program. We recognize that everyone needs an occasional recharge, so we offer a flexible PTO policy for exempt TrueCar Crew, along with a generous PTO accrual policy for non-exempt TrueCar Crew, in addition to 14 company-paid holidays and 2 floating holidays. In short, we care deeply about our crew members and build employee-centric programs that prove it.

At TrueCar, we believe in the power of diversity to build a deeper understanding of our consumers and partners and drive innovation in our products. We welcome a workforce that reflects the diversity of car-buying consumers. We encourage everyone interested in our company's mission to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, age, or any other trait that is protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with applicable law. In addition, TrueCar will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

TrueCar does not accept unsolicited agency submissions.

If you are based in California, we encourage you to read this important information for California residents

#LI-Remote

title: Director, Paid Services
description:
Location

Remote United States

Employment Type

Full time

Location Type

Remote

Department

Services & Support

Compensation

$130K – $180K • Offers Commission • Offers Bonus

***The base salary range for this position is commensurate with work location, experience, skills, certifications, education, and prior accomplishments. The position may be eligible for additional compensation, including a bonus, commission and/or equity, as applicable.***

  

For over four decades, PAR Technology Corporation (NYSE: PAR) has been a leader in restaurant technology, empowering brands worldwide to create lasting connections with their guests. Our innovative solutions and commitment to excellence provide comprehensive software and hardware that enable seamless experiences and drive growth for over 100,000 restaurants in more than 110 countries. Embracing our "Better Together" ethos, we offer Unified Customer Experience solutions, combining point-of-sale, digital ordering, loyalty and back-office software solutions as well as industry-leading hardware and drive-thru offerings. To learn more, visit partech.com or connect with us on LinkedIn, X (formerly Twitter), Facebook, and Instagram.

**Position Description:**

We are seeking a dynamic and strategic Director of Paid Services to lead and grow our fast-evolving paid services organization. This leader will oversee our team of loyalty consultants and managed services professionals—owning the P&L, scaling operations, and evolving our model from executional support to a strategic driver of customer outcomes.

As part of the Engagement Cloud team, this role is central to helping enterprise and mid-market restaurants unlock more value from our platform. You’ll shape the roadmap for managed loyalty services, lead a high-performing team, and partner cross-functionally to position services as a key differentiator in our go-to-market strategy.

This is an ideal role for a leader with deep experience in loyalty, SaaS, restaurants, and agency or professional services leadership—someone excited to build and expand a services business.

**Position Location:**

Remote, United States

**What We’re Looking For:**

Requirements:

* 10+ years of experience in professional services, loyalty strategy, or managed services—ideally in a SaaS or digital agency environment.
* Deep expertise in the restaurant industry and a strong grasp of loyalty program economics and guest behavior.
* Proven success owning or influencing a P&L and driving revenue growth and margin expansion.
* Experience leading multi-disciplinary teams and scaling service delivery models.
* Strong business acumen and strategic thinking; able to build from scratch, test new models, and evolve offerings quickly.
* Excellent cross-functional leadership and client-facing communication skills.
* Thoughtful, data-informed decision maker with a customer-first mindset.

  Additional skills:
* Experience working within a SaaS restaurant tech company or partnering with enterprise restaurant brands.
* Previous work with loyalty platforms, CDPs, or campaign analytics tools.
* Familiarity with Salesforce, BI tools, and service automation platforms.

**Unleash your potential: What you will be doing and owning:**

Strategic Leadership & Vision

* Define and continuously evolve the roadmap for paid services, aligned with our product vision and customer lifecycle maturity.
* Own the internal and external narrative of our services value proposition.

Business Ownership

* Own full P&L responsibility for the Paid Services organization, including revenue, margin, and profitability.
* Develop pricing models, packaging, and scalable service tiers that align with client segments and internal capabilities.
* Identify and validate new service offerings that complement and enhance our core SaaS platform.

Cross-Functional Influence

* Collaborate with Product, Data, and Engineering to ensure our services and platform are integrated and mutually reinforcing.
* Partner with Sales and Marketing to enable pipeline growth, define value messaging, and position services as a core part of our ecosystem.

Align closely with Customer Success and Support to ensure cohesive delivery and an exceptional customer experience.

Customer Strategy & Impact

* Serve as an executive sponsor or escalation point for strategic accounts utilizing managed services.
* Ensure client programs drive measurable outcomes (e.g., guest frequency, check size, retention) and translate those outcomes into ROI-driven narratives.
* Lead the creation of loyalty frameworks, strategy playbooks, and campaign models for broad client adoption.

Team Building & Organizational Growth

* Lead, coach, and scale a high-performing team of loyalty strategists, campaign managers, analysts, and client partners.
* Set clear KPIs, expectations, and professional development paths to drive accountability and results.
* Expand delivery capacity through process innovation, automation, and a mix of internal talent and external resources.

Thought Leadership & Market Positioning

* Represent the company externally at conferences, in client meetings, and through published insights on loyalty and restaurant growth.
* Maintain a strong pulse on industry trends, competitive offerings, and client needs to ensure our services stay ahead of the curve.

* **Interview Process:**
* Interview #1: Phone Screen with Talent Acquisition Team
* Interview #2: Video interview with the Hiring Manager (via MS Teams)
* Interview #3: Video interview with the VP (via MS Teams)
* Interview #4: Presentation to team (via MS. Teams)

PAR is proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. We also provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities in accordance with applicable laws. If you require reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, or for your role at PAR, please contact accommodations@partech.com. If you’d like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant, please visit the US Department of Labor's website.

title: Data Manager
description:
**Data Manager - Position Description**
---------------------------------------

ICI Services is an Employee-Owned Company providing Engineering & Integration, Systems Acquisition, Information Warfare, and In-Service Sustainment support to government customers. We are seeking a **Data Manager** to support our Navy customer in **Washington, DC.**

**Security Clearance:**

* Applicant must be eligible to hold an active Department of Defense (DoD) SECRET personnel security clearance.

**Position/Job Description:** General Tasking Description:

* **Organize and Coordinate Data Management Programs**: Oversee the organization and coordination of Navy's data management programs.
* **Support Navy's Data Manager**: Provide support to the Navy's Data Manager in managing data initiatives and projects.
* **Report Findings and Recommendations**: Collect, analyze, and report findings and recommendations to the Government in written reports and oral presentations.
* **Implement Recommendations**: Assist in implementing recommendations provided in data management projects.
* **Data Analysis and Reporting**: Conduct data analysis to support decision-making and provide actionable insights.
* **Documentation and Compliance**: Ensure all data management activities are properly documented and comply with relevant standards and regulations.
* **Stakeholder Communication**: Communicate effectively with stakeholders to understand data management needs and provide updates on project progress.
* **Training and Support**: Provide training and support to team members and stakeholders on data management processes and best practices.

**Experience Requirements:**

* 7 years of professional experience in data management.

**Educational & Certification Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in any field.

**EOE/M/F/ Disability/Vet/**

**VEVRAA Federal Contractor**

  

**Benefits**
------------

ICI Services provides a comprehensive, competitive benefits package.

Our benefits:

* 401(k) Plan with Immediately Vesting Match

* Health Insurance

--------------------

ICI Services is an Employee-Owned Business with a proud history of providing Engineering & Integration, Systems Acquisition, Information Warfare, and In-Service Sustainment to our government customers. We are headquartered in Virginia Beach, VA.

title: Cost Estimator
description:
**Cost Estimator - Position Description**
-----------------------------------------

We have immediate hire openings for **Cost Estimator** to join our PMS 515 Team supporting Business Financial Management (BFM) team, **Washington, DC** who wants to grow with the Company. ICI Services is a 100% Employee-Owned small business celebrating our 25th year delivering superior products and responsive services aligned to customers’ needs. Our employee-owners include acquisition analysts, financial analysts, engineers, configuration specialists, logisticians, technicians, IT professionals, and ship production specialists providing integral, quality support to multiple Navy organizations. We are headquartered in Virginia Beach, VA.

**Security Clearance:**

* Applicant must be eligible to hold an active Department of Defense (DoD) SECRET personnel security clearance.

**Responsibilities**

* **Cost Analysis and Assessments**: Provide detailed cost-related analysis and assessments of ships, submarines, and related ship systems.
* **Technical Expertise:** Offer technical expertise in cost estimation, performing parametric trade-off studies, and assessing cost estimates.
* **Use of Computational Tools:** Utilize modern computational tools and spreadsheets to conduct cost assessments, including tools such as the USN’s Visibility and Management of Operating Costs (VAMOSC) databases and the Operating and Support Cost Analysis Model (OSCAM) suite of cost models.
* **Program Life Cycle Cost Estimates**: Develop program life cycle cost estimates for surface ship and submarine programs.
* **Trade-off Studies**: Perform concepts and technology trade-off studies to support cost estimation and decision-making.
* **Documentation and Reporting**: Prepare detailed reports documenting cost assessments, methodologies, and findings.
* **Collaboration**: Work collaboratively with project teams and stakeholders to provide cost-related insights and recommendations.
* **Compliance and Standards**: Ensure all cost estimation activities comply with relevant standards and regulations.

**Experience Requirements:**

* 7 years of professional experience in financial analysis.
* Preferred experience includes DoD/DoN procedures and Policies (DoD 5000 process).

**Educational & Certification Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Engineering, or a related field.
* Certified in the Cost Estimating career field.
