title: Analyst, Creative Data & Analytics
description:
* Data Sciences
* New York, New York
* Publicis CoLab
* Entry
* Hybrid
* 6/16/2025
* 112137
* 25-7012

**Company description**

CoLab is a fully integrated, cross-discipline team that provides best-in-class services in a fluid and modular way. With our clients at the center, we create brand movement at the speed of people’s lives by connecting real-time data with world-class creative, content, and media in service of growth and Return on investment.

CoLab is a “power of one” solution, encompassing data, media, and production. By drawing from across the vast Publicis Groupe network, we are uniquely positioned to deliver innovation and specialized skills to our clients, as well as enriching opportunities and inclusive benefits to our employees. We pride ourselves on combining the atmosphere of a startup company with the stability and experience of a global leader.

  
  
**Overview**

**We’re searching for an Analyst, Creative Analytics** who will be a key contributor within the core Data and Analytics (DNA) team. Data and Analytics is structured into three specialties: Data Intelligence, Data Strategy and Data Technology.

Data Intelligence leaders are responsible for developing and translating the data story in meaningful ways anding analytical insights to business challenges. This requires being a jack-of-all-trades when it comes to business and marketing performance analytics. Data Intelligence leads are responsible for the foundational elements that make our clients better able to plan, optimize, measure, and share the performance of their marketing efforts.

  
  
**Responsibilities**

**Tasks and responsibilities include:**

* Support the development of the overall measurement strategy for clients through discovery and development of measurement plans, learning agendas, and test plans
* Support and execute the measurement plan
* Day-to-day collaboration with internal teams
* Contribute to client communications and deliverables, helping to define the story in a simple and concise way and communicating success of client’s marketing efforts
* Contribute to day-to-day client deliverables
* Conduct hands-on analysis, crafting insights that help improve performance
* Through compelling data visualizations, develop, maintain and communicate insights, key metrics and reports, highlighting opportunities for improvement
* Keep internal stakeholders informed about new opportunities, issues and performance succeses.
* Foster and contribute to a team environment

  
**Qualifications**

**To qualify, you’ll need:**

* Four year degree (with a business focus such as Statistics, Economics, Finance or Marketing)
* Master’s degree (preferred)
* Knowledge of the digital environment and in aligning marketing strategies with business needs
* Knowledge of integrated marketing and CRM disciplines (including primary research, segmentation, targeting, direct marketing and customer care)
* Ability to independently diagnose and troubleshoot
* Ability to work across multiple disciplines and teams
* Excellent written, oral communication and presentation skills
* Hands on experience manipulating data and developing visually compelling reports
* Proven record with strong client relationship skills
* Strong familiarity with the digital environment and tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, DCM, etc.)
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office
* Candidate must be open to travel as needed

  
**Additional information**

Our Publicis Groupe motto “Viva La Différence” means we’re better together, and we believe that our differences make us stronger. It means we honor and celebrate all identities, across all facets of intersectionality, and it underpins all that we do as an organization. We are focused on fostering belonging and creating equitable & inclusive experiences for all talent.

Publicis Groupe provides robust and inclusive benefit programs and policies to support the evolving and diverse needs of our talent and enable every person to grow and thrive. Our benefits package includes medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401K, as well as parental and family care leave, family forming assistance, tuition reimbursement, and flexible time off.

Compensation Range: $74,000 - $83,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. Temporary roles may be eligible to participate in our freelancer/temporary employee medical plan through a third-party benefits administration system once certain criteria have been met. Temporary roles may also qualify for participation in our 401(k) plan after eligibility criteria have been met. For regular roles, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off.

If you require accommodation or assistance with the application or onboarding process specifically, please contact USMSTACompliance@publicis.com. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
* Customer Analytics
  + Analyze customer demographics, behavior patterns, and financial data to segment customers into distinct groups for targeted outreach efforts, including email, direct mail, digital advertising, calling, and more, based on department or organizational goals and criteria.
  + Conduct market analysis to identify emerging trends, market potential, competitor activity, and customer needs to inform marketing strategy development.
  + Develop predictive models to identify potential customers most likely to respond to specific marketing offers, enabling targeted outreach and lead generation.
* Campaign Support:
  + Help execute A/B testing on marketing campaigns to identify the most effective messaging, landing pages, and call-to-actions.
  + Work with Marketing staff to provide queries, data, or other assistance needed to deliver personalized promotions, trigger-based messages, and drip campaigns.
  + Provide market analysis and customer acquisition data to assist with campaign promotional offers, target lists
* Reporting
  + Create clear and concise reports with data visualizations to communicate key findings and actionable insights to marketing teams and senior management.
  + Create weekly/monthly reporting on marketing efforts (traditional, digital, and alternative) of products and services.
  + Track key metrics like click-through rates, conversion rates, and ROI across different marketing channels to evaluate campaign effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.
  + Work with other departments and teams to coordinate data importing, reporting, and other tasks.
* Non-Essential Functions:
  + Perform special projects, research and other duties as assigned.

**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities**

* Experience in marketing principles including customer segmentation, targeting, and positioning, digital marketing channels (SEO, PPC, email, social media, etc.) and campaign performance metrics (CTR, conversion rate, ROI, etc.) Expert with data analytics.
* Knowledgeable in how to build and use several data analytic tools
* Skilled in updating various databases
* Exceptional analytical and logic skills
* Preferred:
* Knowledge of MCIF database system management
* Intermediate to advanced knowledge of report writing using Microsoft Power BI or a similar Business Intelligence tool
* Knowledge of statistical analysis and methodology
* Advanced skill level in Excel
* Strong understanding of retail banking business financial drivers

**Minimum Qualifications**

Bachelor's degree in marketing, information science or related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience AND 5 years' experience in a data analytics role.

Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Payment Analyst - Remote
description:
**GENERAL SUMMARY:**

The Payment Analyst at Vantage West Credit Union is a strategic and detail-oriented professional responsible for optimizing payment operations and innovating digital payment products. This role manages the entire lifecycle of various payment methods, including RTP, FedNow, Wire Transfers, ACH, Crypto and Card-based systems. The Payment Analyst ensures alignment with business objectives and member needs, collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver user-friendly and technically feasible payment solutions.

The Payment Analyst will lead the payments vision by partnering with multiple departments (Lending, Deposit Operations, IT, Risk Management, Compliance, Marketing, and Member Experience). Conduct market research and competitive analysis. Prioritize features and improvements to align with company goals. Own and communicate the product roadmap. Track KPI’s and use data-driven insights to inform product decisions.

  

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

**Minimum Education & Experience Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Technology, Finance, or a related field, or equivalent progressive experience.
* Minimum 4 years of experience in payments or financial services.

**Minimum Knowledge & Skill Requirements:**

* Knowledge with Agile methodologies and tools.
* Outstanding communication, presentation, and leadership skills.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to multitask effectively in a high-paced, highly visible role.
* Ability to develop, monitor, and analyze KPIs to measure the effectiveness of payment strategies, providing insights and recommendations for continuous improvement.
* Knowledge of end-to-end customer experience integration and dependencies.
* Ability to lead process improvement projects, manage product backlogs, and prioritize activities to ensure alignment with product strategy and business goals.
* Experience in working closely with cross-functional teams and external vendors to deliver high-quality payment solutions.

  

**COMPETENCIES:**

* Problem Solving
* Functional/Technical Skills
* Process Management
* Customer Focus
* Decision Quality
* Strategic Agility & Planning
* Adaptability and Continuous Learning

**WORKING CONDITIONS/ENVIRONMENT:**

This job requires the employee to sit or stand for extended periods of time. Infrequent lifting up to 25 lbs.

  

**OTHER REQUIREMENTS:**

Must comply with all aspects of the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA). .

  

**MAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIES AND TASKS:**

* **Product Strategy & Vision:** Develop and drive the overall strategy for digital payments products, ensuring alignment with company goals and objectives. Act as a storyteller, gathering information from stakeholders and delivering a product from inception to launch.
* **Collaboration & Leadership:** Work closely with cross-functional teams during product visioning and concept development.
* **Product Lifecycle Management:** Manage the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to launch and beyond, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with business objectives. Continuously assess value and prioritize stories, epics, and themes to maximize product impact.
* **Market Research & Innovation:** Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify opportunities for innovation and improvement in digital payment offerings.
* **Product Roadmap & KPIs:** Own and communicate the product roadmap, provide regular updates to stakeholders, and define and track KPIs to inform product decisions.
* **User Experience & Improvement:** Continuously make improvements and fixes to the product to enhance the customer experience, ensuring product designs are user-friendly and aligned with business goals.
* **Process Improvement & Automation:** Lead process improvement projects and identify opportunities to leverage automation and AI/ML technologies to streamline operations and optimize payment strategies.
* **Vendor & Partner Management:** Build and maintain strong relationships with external vendors and partners, negotiate contracts, and ensure optimal service levels.
* **Change Management:** Champion change management principles by leading training initiatives and ensuring seamless transitions during system updates, integrations, or migrations.
* **Cryptocurrency:** Research and analyze the potential impacts and value propositions of offering cryptocurrency-related services, including technical requirements, security considerations, and regulatory challenges.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

  

Salary range is $71,805.29-$94,244.45. Job Grade, EX 14. Final salary is dependent on candidate's experience and qualifications.

Equal Opportunity Employer Veterans Disabled

Equal Opportunity Employer  
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Principal Product Manager
description:
Senior Product Manager - InsurTech Employee Benefits (San Diego,CA)

San Diego, CA | On-site 4 days a week

Why Choose Acrisure?

Acrisure Innovation is where human expertise meets advanced technology.

Acrisure Innovation is a fast paced, AI-driven team building innovative software to disrupt the $6T+ insurance industry. Our mission is to help the world share its risk more intelligently to power a more vibrant economy. To do this, we are transforming insurance distribution and underwriting into a science.

At the core of our operating model is our technology: we’re building a digital marketplace for risk and applying it at the center of Acrisure, a privately held company recognized as one of the world's top 10 insurance brokerages and the fastest growing insurance brokerage globally. By leveraging technology to push the boundaries of understanding and transferring risk, we are systematically converting data into predictions, insights, and choices, and we believe we can remove the constraints associated with scale, scope, and learning that have existed in the insurance industry for centuries.

Our culture is strong. We are a collaborative company of entrepreneurial, innovative, and talented people who believe in our future. We outthink and out work the competition. We look outside our walls and are energized by our fast-paced trajectory.

Our vision for the future is clear. We have limitless potential to achieve unprecedented success in the insurance industry. To achieve our opportunity, a best-in-class Team must support us.

The Role

As a Senior Product Manager, you will own and drive world-class customer experiences throughout the software lifecycle. With the ability to cut through the noise and focus on what really matters, you will serve as a product owner within an agile scrum team to prioritize the backlog and work on the most impactful features. You are customer-centric, continuously demonstrate strategic & analytical abilities, and are laser focused on execution. In this role, you will partner with diverse cross-functional teams to lead, execute, monitor, and deliver results. You must have the ability to succeed in a matrix environment, where success is dependent on your ability to collaborate with cross-functional partners in a positive,productive, and transparent way.

Here are some of the ways in which you’ll achieve impact:

* Understand Acrisure Innovation’s strategic and competitive position to deliver products that are recognized best in class
* Use UX Research and Data to identify and prioritize product opportunities
* Be a leader - help shape the company product strategy and inspire others to execute on it
* Own the Roadmap - from long-term vision to short-term execution plans
* Drive product development to build end to end solutions with a team of designers, engineers, and analysts
* Serve as a product owner within an agile scrum team, write user stories, prioritize the product backlog, and work closely with engineers and designers on the team
* Create a deep understanding of our customers and analyze current customer experiences to define friction points and create seamless and effortless experiences
* Define launch outcomes and ongoing product performance to help build best in class experiences
* Work with the Success team to craft and execute launch plans
* Build thrush and effective relationships with peers/cross-functional teams and provide leadership across the product, engineering, and business teams

You may be fit for this role if you have:

* Five or more years of enterprise software Product Management experience, preferably working on browser-based SaaS products
* A strong sense of end user empathy and a healthy curiosity about a fascinating business domain
* Strong ability to translate product needs to technology. Detail-oriented, unfazed by technical detail, committed to flawless execution
* An ability to move up the learning curve very quickly
* Ability to participate in technical discussions and help make technical trade-offs
* Experience working with AI-driven products
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Team player: ability to develop relationships and collaborate at all levels
* Maintain a high level of integrity and ability to use good judgement
* Relevant degree or equivalent practical experience

#LI-onsite

#BI-onsite

Acrisure is committed to employing a diverse workforce. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status. California residents can learn more about our privacy practices for applicants by visiting the Acrisure California Applicant Privacy Policy available at

www.Acrisure.com/privacy/caapplicant

.

To Executive Search Firms & Staffing Agencies: Acrisure does not accept unsolicited resumes from any agencies that have not signed a mutual service agreement. All unsolicited resumes will be considered Acrisure’s property, and Acrisure will not be obligated to pay a referral fee. This includes resumes submitted directly to Hiring Managers without contacting Acrisure’s Human Resources Talent Department.

title: Senior Data Operations Engineer
description:
Senior Data Operations Engineer

Austin, TX (Onsite 4 days per week)

Acrisure Innovation is where human expertise meets advanced technology.

Acrisure Innovation is a fast paced, AI-driven team building innovative software to disrupt the $6T+ insurance industry. Our mission is to help the world share its risk more intelligently to power a more vibrant economy. To do this, we are transforming insurance distribution and underwriting into a science.

At the core of our operating model is our technology: we’re building a digital marketplace for risk and applying it at the center of Acrisure, a privately held company recognized as one of the world's top 10 insurance brokerages and the fastest growing insurance brokerage globally. By leveraging technology to push the boundaries of understanding and transferring risk, we are systematically converting data into predictions, insights, and choices, and we believe we can remove the constraints associated with scale, scope, and learning that have existed in the insurance industry for centuries.

Our culture is strong. We are a collaborative company of entrepreneurial, innovative, and talented people who believe in our future. We outthink and out work the competition. We look outside our walls and are energized by our fast-paced trajectory.

Our vision for the future is clear. We have limitless potential to achieve unprecedented success in the insurance industry. To achieve our opportunity, a best-in-class Team must support us.

Learn more about Acrisure Innovation:

https://builtin.com/company/acrisure-innovation

The Innovation team’s mission is to unify data across the enterprise to optimize business decisions made at the strategic, tactical, and operational levels of the organization. We accomplish this by building a data lakehouse that powers analytics and reporting platforms, and business processes that provide quality data, in a timely fashion, from any channel of the company and present them in such a manner as to maximize the value of that data for both internal and external customers.

We’re seeking a skilled Senior Data Ops Engineer to join our Data & Technology team. This person will be instrumental in monitoring and supporting our modern data integration pipelines—primarily built on Azure Data Factory (ADF), Databricks, PowerBI, and SQL Server. While legacy SSIS is still in place, our focus is on modernizing the stack.

The ideal candidate will proactively troubleshoot ETL jobs, manage data pipelines, help land external data into the Enterprise Data Lakehouse, and ensure seamless performance of integrations. This is a cross-functional role, working closely with Data Engineering, Data Intelligence, and Analytics teams.

Responsibilities:

* Onboard and curate data sources including data preparation/ELT and modeling to enable data consumption by analytics and AI teams
* Act as a Solution Architect and Technology Leader – ability to make decisions in the face of ambiguity and solve difficult technical problems.
* Onboard, Lead, and Mentor junior and mid-level developers.
* Work closely with Data Source contacts, Analysts, Product and Data Intelligence teams to identify opportunities and assess improvements of our products and services.
* Contribute to workshops with the business user community to further their knowledge and use of the data ecosystem.
* Produce and maintain accurate project documentation, project planning and presentations.
* Collaborate with various data providers to resolve dashboard, reporting and data related issues.
* Perform Data benchmarking, enhancements, optimizations, and platform analytics.
* Participate in the research, development, and adoption of trends in technology, data and analytics
* Monitor and troubleshoot nightly ETL pipelines, primarily built in Databricks, Azure Data Factory (ADF), and SQL Server to ensure reliable data flow and minimal downtime.
* Resolve data issues, collaborating with BI Analysts, and Engineering teams to address data latency, quality, and integration problems quickly and effectively.
* Implement and maintain monitoring and alerting systems using Azure Monitor, Log Analytics, and custom dashboards to proactively catch and address failures.
* Administer and optimize SQL Server databases, including indexing, performance tuning, backups, HA availability groups, transactional replication, and resource management to support fast and efficient queries.
* Ingest and land external data securely using replication, SFTP, or Azure Private Endpoints, ensuring readiness for EDW integration.
* Develop automation scripts to reduce manual work in data validation, pipeline checks, and recovery workflows.
* Manage secret rotation and credential handling securely through Azure Key Vault, ensuring SOCS 2 compliance.
* Contribute to modernization efforts, migrating legacy SSIS workflows to scalable ADF and Databricks platforms.
* Optimize performance and scalability of workflows in Databricks notebooks and SQL Server stored procedures, addressing bottlenecks and improving execution speed.
* Participate in root cause analysis and drive incident resolution and continuous improvements through post-incident reviews.
* Support data governance and compliance, working with security teams on access controls, auditing, and policy enforcement.
* Document operational procedures, and maintain runbooks, playbooks, and support guides to enable consistency, onboarding, and knowledge transfer.

Qualifications & Requirements:

Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent experience along with a demonstrated desire for continuing education and improvement.

Experience:

* 8-10 years of hands-on experience working with Azure cloud services, including Data Factory, Databricks, PowerBI, and SQL Server.
* Strong hands-on experience with Data Lake & Delta Lake Concepts.
* Strong hands-on experience with Databricks Unity Catalog and usage in dealing with Delta tables.
* Ability to Analyze, summarize, and characterize large or small data sets with varying degrees of fidelity or quality, and identify and explain any insights or patterns within them.
* Experience with multi-source data warehouses
* Experience with other cloud environments (GCP) a definite plus.
* Experience in data analytics and reporting, particularly with Power BI a plus
* Hands on experience building logical data models and physical data models
* Write SQL fluently, recognize and correct inefficient or error-prone SQL, and perform test-driven validation of SQL queries and their results.
* Create and share standards, best practices, documentation and reference examples for data warehouse, integration/ELT systems, and end user reporting
* Apply disciplined approach to testing software and data, identifying data anomalies, and correcting both data errors and their root causes
* Should be well versed with Key Vault \\ create & maintenance and usage of secrets in both Databricks & ADF
* Should be knowledgeable in Stored procedures \\ functions and be able to use them by ADF & Databricks as this is a widely used Practice in Acrisure.
* Should be familiar with DevOps process for Azure artifacts and database artifacts.
* Should be well versed with ADF concepts like chaining pipelines, passing parameters, using APIs for ADF & Databricks to perform various activities.
* Should be well versed with Agile and Scrum principles and procedures, and working with Jira
* Proven ability to build, manage, and troubleshoot data pipelines in Databricks and ADF, ensuring reliability and performance.
* Deep familiarity with SQL Server administration—from tuning queries and managing indexes to backups and performance optimization.
* Strong knowledge of SQL Server security best practices, including patching, maintenance plans, and access control.
* Willingness to participate in an on-call rotation for Sev 0 alerts, including occasional weekend support as part of a shared schedule.
* Solid understanding of monitoring and observability tools like Azure Monitor, Log Analytics, and Key Vault for secure and visible operations.
* Comfortable managing secret rotation and credential security in cloud environments, with a strong awareness of data security best practices.
* Versatile in working with various data formats and sources—structured and unstructured—including CSV, JSON, XML, binary column-based formats (Parquet, Arrow), databases, and Azure storage.
* Strong grasp of relational and dimensional data modeling, with experience translating models into efficient, scalable systems.
* Skilled in debugging, tuning, and enhancing workflows across Databricks notebooks and SQL-based transformations.
* Detail-oriented when it comes to documentation, producing clear, actionable runbooks and technical guides.
* Collaborative and communicative across functions, able to explain technical issues clearly and work effectively in cross-functional teams.
* Adaptable in fast-paced environments, with a proactive approach to ownership and accountability.
* Bonus: Experience with IAC (Terraform), Azure Web Applications, DBT or involvement in data governance and compliance initiatives.

Additional Qualifications:

* Excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize, communicate and execute tasks across multiple projects with tight deadlines and aggressive goals.
* Expert working knowledge of SQL, Python, Scala and Spark, and demonstrated ability to create ad-hoc SQL queries to analyze data, create prototypes, etc.
* Ability to understand complex issues and clearly articulate complex ideas.
* Demonstrated ability to champion change, influence, and drive results in a complex organization.
* Ability to mentor junior developers and contribute to the growth of the team.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Experience working in a Multi-Cloud Environment a Plus
* Experience working with dbt a Plus
* Knowledge of the Insurance Industry or FinTech a Plus

Acrisure is committed to employing a diverse workforce. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status. California residents can learn more about our privacy practices for applicants by visiting the Acrisure California Applicant Privacy Policy available at

www.Acrisure.com/privacy/caapplicant

.

To Executive Search Firms & Staffing Agencies: Acrisure does not accept unsolicited resumes from any agencies that have not signed a mutual service agreement. All unsolicited resumes will be considered Acrisure’s property, and Acrisure will not be obligated to pay a referral fee. This includes resumes submitted directly to Hiring Managers without contacting Acrisure’s Human Resources Talent Department.

Austin, TX (Onsite 4 days a week)

Our culture is strong. We are a collaborative company of entrepreneurial, innovative, and talented people who believe in our future. We outthink and out work the competition. We look outside our walls and are energized by our fast-paced trajectory.

Position Overview:

We accomplish this by building a data lakehouse that powers analytics and reporting platforms, and business processes that provide quality data, in a timely fashion, from any channel of the company and present them in such a manner as to maximize the value of that data for both internal and external customers.

The Senior Data Engineer is responsible for designing and developing complex ELT processes required to populate our data lakehouse which supplies data for the Product, AI & Data Intelligence teams. Responsibility includes hands-on contributions in data engineering and data architecture working with a team of full time and contracted developers as well as coaching and mentoring junior and mid-level developers. Ensuring high quality and best practices are maintained through the development cycle is key to this position.

Responsibilities:

* Leverage established guidelines and custom designs to create complex ELT processes to meet the needs of the business.

* Onboard and curate data sources including data preparation/ELT and modeling to enable data consumption by analytics and AI teams

* Act as a Solution Architect and Technology Leader – ability to make decisions in the face of ambiguity and solve difficult technical problems.

* Lead discovery, requirements, level of effort estimation and project planning for strategic company initiatives.

* Independently determine methods and procedures for new or existing requirements and functionality.

* Onboard, Lead, and Mentor junior and mid-level developers.

* Work closely with Data Source contacts, Analysts, Product and Data Intelligence teams to identify opportunities and assess improvements of our products and services.

* Contribute to workshops with the business user community to further their knowledge and use of the data ecosystem.

* Produce and maintain accurate project documentation, project planning and presentations.

* Collaborate with various data providers to resolve dashboard, reporting and data related issues.

* Perform Data benchmarking, enhancements, optimizations, and platform analytics.

* Participate in the research, development, and adoption of trends in technology, data and analytics

Qualifications & Requirements:

Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent experience along with a demonstrated desire for continuing education and improvement.

Experience:

* Minimum 8-10 years in Data Engineering, preferably with expertise in an Azure environment with Data Bricks, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake.

* Minimum 8-10 years architecting and designing data warehouses, data modeling, and end-to-end ELT processes

* Successfully delivered 5+ end to end projects – from Inception to Execution - in Data Engineering / Data Science / Data Integration as a Tech Lead/Principal

* Strong hands-on experience with Data Lake & Delta Lake Concepts.

* Strong hands-on experience with Databricks Unity Catalog and usage in dealing with Delta tables.

* Ability to Analyze, summarize, and characterize large or small data sets with varying degrees of fidelity or quality, and identify and explain any insights or patterns within them.

* Experience with multi-source data warehouses

* Experience with other cloud environments (GCP) a definite plus.

* Experience in data analytics and reporting, particularly with Power BI a plus

* Hands on experience building logical data models and physical data models

* Write SQL fluently, recognize and correct inefficient or error-prone SQL, and perform test-driven validation of SQL queries and their results.

* Create and share standards, best practices, documentation and reference examples for data warehouse, integration/ELT systems, and end user reporting

* Apply disciplined approach to testing software and data, identifying data anomalies, and correcting both data errors and their root causes

* Should be well versed with Key Vault \\ create & maintenance and usage of secrets in both Databricks & ADF

* Should be knowledgeable in Stored procedures \\ functions and be able to use them by ADF & Databricks as this is a widely used Practice in Acrisure.

* Should be familiar with DevOps process for Azure artifacts and database artifacts.

* Should be well versed with ADF concepts like chaining pipelines, passing parameters, using APIs for ADF & Databricks to perform various activities.

* Should be well versed with Agile and Scrum principles and procedures, and working with Jira

Additional Qualifications:

* Excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize, communicate and execute tasks across multiple projects with tight deadlines and aggressive goals.

* Expert working knowledge of SQL, Python and Spark, and demonstrated ability to create ad-hoc SQL queries to analyze data, create prototypes, etc.

* Ability to understand complex issues and clearly articulate complex ideas.

* Demonstrated ability to champion change, influence, and drive results in a complex organization.

* Ability to mentor junior developers and contribute to the growth of the team.

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

* Experience working in a Multi-Cloud Environment a Plus

* Experience working with dbt a Plus

* Knowledge of the Insurance Industry or FinTech a Plus

Acrisure is equally committed to supporting social issues. In its home of Grand Rapids, Acrisure provided $15 million to create the Acrisure Center for Innovation in Children’s Health at Helen DeVos Children’s Hospital.

Acrisure is committed to employing a diverse workforce. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

title: Management Analyst (JSE Sustainment and Logistics Support)-Journeyman
location: Naval Air Station Patuxent River, MD, US
description:
AMEWAS is celebrating over 40 years of excellence in providing quality products, services and solutions to the Department of Defense (DoD), specializing in the scientific, engineering, and testing of the full spectrum of weapons development. We are headquartered in California, Maryland and operate satellite offices in Orlando, Florida and San Diego, California.
  
  
At AMEWAS, you will find a diverse team of professionals that work to make a true difference in the operational support of our nation's warfighters. Our employees achieve success through continuous learning and high performance, and are consistently recognized by their customers and their peers.
  
  
If you are ready to challenge yourself to do more, join our team today!
  
  
Be sure to check out the rest of our website at www.amewas.com to learn more about our company and our people.
  
  
**The Position:**  
AMEWAS is seeking a highly motivated and talented Management Analyst (JSE Sustainment and Logistics Support)-Journeyman to support Advanced Aircraft Research, Development, Test & Evaluation. The salary range of this position is $98,000.00 - $160,000.00, and is commensurate with experience. This position is eligible for hybrid work.
  
  
**About the location:**  
Washington, D.C. and Patuxent River, Maryland #1 City Hiring the Most High-Tech Workers (California-Lexington Park, Maryland). To learn more about our surrounding location, please visit: Visit St. Mary's.https://www.visitalbuquerque.org/. To learn more about Washington, D.C. please visit: https://washington.org/.
  
  
**Position Background:**  
The Joint Simulation Environment (JSE) is a scalable, expandable, high fidelity government-owned, non-proprietary modeling and simulation environment used to conduct testing on fifth-plus generation aircraft and systems accreditable for test as a supplement to open-air testing and Pilot training. Be part of the team expanding JSE from IOT&E into a functioning test and training environment. In this role you will provide analytical, technical and administrative support to the Joint Simulation Environment (JSE)
  
  
A typical day as a Management Analyst (JSE Sustainment and Logistics Support)-Journeyman may include:
  
  

* Acts as logistics manager providing product management and leadership support to the Joint Simulation Environment (JSE) Integrated Product Team (IPT) Lead within the F-35 Lightning II Joint Program Office (JPO)
* Assists with all aspects of logistics planning, execution and management with an emphasis on site activations, diminishing manufacturing sources resolution management, hardware inventory and configuration and long-term sustainment
* Provides logistics management support for all F-35 JSE product support planning, documentation and execution
* Supports the development and execution of the JSE logistics approach
* Coordinates with TSS PMO Product Support Manager and other logisticians within the PMO, JPO and the JSE Enterprise to ensure a sound approach that meets product support requirements and best practices
* Coordinates across the PMO, JPO and JSE Enterprise to define and develop artifacts required for program reviews
* Provides reach-back to Subject Matter Experts from the logistics competency based on JSE team needs and gaps in knowledge or expertise
* Supports the JSE IPT program management team with development roadmaps, program schedules and the alignment of technical activities within and outside the JSE Enterprise that enables product support and sustainment
* Assists the JSE Lead in gaining insight into prime contractor's plans, schedules and methods of execution for logistics activities
* Provides timely analysis of prime contractor plans, methods and status of execution
* Monitors all aspects of Lockheed Martin F-35 In-a-Box (FIAB) sustainment and integration to the JSE
* Reviews Basis of Estimates (BOEs) and provides technical input to assist the JSE Lead in negotiating cost of contractor support
* Serves as the logistics point of contact for F-35 IAB product support management
* Organizes and actively participates in technical working groups, panels and teams, etc. in support of FIAB, JSE system and enterprise configuration/planning
* Assists the JSE lead and Finance Manager with spend plan development and execution management for all product support and sustainment activities funded by the IPT

**Must-haves:**  

* BS Degree
* 7 years of relevant work experience
* Mid-level experience (7 years) with logistics and/or acquisition management in the domain of military tactical aviation acquisition and sustainment
* The ability to independently plan and complete assignments
* The ability to demonstrate initiative and be a self-starter
* The ability to work with minimal supervision
* The ability to take direction, create a more defined approach and lead others to accomplish the goals, projects and missions
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* The ability to manage quick response time while maintaining attention to detail
* The ability to accommodate a hybrid schedule (in the office at least 1 day per week and for any classified meetings)
* The ability to maintain a DoD Secret Security Clearance-Secret Clearance required to start

**Desired Skills:**  

* MS Degree in technical field or logistics management
* DAWIA certification requirements for Level II Logistics
* 15 years of work experience in field related to military tactical aviation product support
* Experience with Major Acquisition Programs
* 4 years of experience in logistics and program management of software-intensive or distributed network programs

**Skills Crucial to Success at AMEWAS:**  
Candidates must have a customer-focused attitude with a high level of professionalism and discretion, and have the ability to work effectively with both management, and as part of a team, to meet project targets.
  
  
**Physical Environment and Working Conditions:**  
The physical environment requires the employee to work in an office, sitting in a cubicle or at a desk, looking at a computer for most of the workday. Work is physically comfortable. The employee has discretion about sitting, walking, standing, etc.
  
  
The employee may be required to travel short distances to offices/conference rooms and buildings on site. In some occasions, the employee may be required to report to offices or buildings near the work site. Overnight travel will be required.
  
  
**Refer a Friend:**  
If you know someone who may be interested in this position, please share this posting. We are a growing team and there may be more opportunities like this one at AMEWAS!
  
  
**Our Excellent Benefits and Perks:**  
Staying connected to our core values sets us apart from our competition! AMEWAS recognizes and rewards performance, dedication, and creativity. We are committed to investing in our employees and their future by providing them with competitive compensation, creative work teams, and the opportunity to grow in their career. We also provide a robust benefits package, including:
  
  

* Medical, dental, vision, 401(k), Life/AD&D/STD/LTD insurance
* Paid vacation, holiday and sick leave
* Generous tuition and training assistance program
* Relocation assistance
* Sign-on bonuses
* Employee longevity recognition
* Community involvement and outreach
* Team building events
* Recognition program
* Wellness program
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Mobile service discount
* Fitness reimbursement program

AMEWAS is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 60-300.5(a) and 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or any other legally protected class.
  
  
AMEWAS participates in E-Verify to confirm eligibility to work in the United States.
  
  
**Please note:** AMEWAS does not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party staffing agencies, recruiters, or headhunters.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**Company Description**

Recognized by Forbes as one of the fastest-growing private companies in the United States, Palmetto believes that choosing to source clean energy from renewable resources like solar power should be a right, not a privilege. As such, we connect homeowners with renewable energy options such as solar power and energy storage systems. Through our marketplace business model, we empower solar sales professionals and solar installation companies with access to our proprietary design platform, financing, customer management system, logistics, and project management. Our #1 focus is a phenomenal experience for our customers and partners, evidenced in our industry-leading Net Promoter Score.  
  
Our employees are our most valuable resource. Palmetto has a promote-from-within culture for talent development. We offer excellent benefits such as unlimited vacation/PTO, medical, dental, and vision coverage, parental leave, and retirement plans.

**Summary of Role**

As the first Data Scientist working on Palmetto's Consumer business, you will partner closely with Product and Engineering counterparts to optimize the consumer journey. Backed by a strong team of data analysts and engineers who work across the rest of Palmetto's business, you will be responsible for developing metrics, analysis, experiments, and production machine learning models that impact the consumer experience.

  

**Key Responsibilities**

* Design, develop, implement and maintain machine learning and statistical algorithms, ranging from simple consumer insights to recommendations to developing data-driven customer journeys
* Own the consumer data model through its entire lifecycle, from instrumentation and application data storage through the BI & data product layers, enabling product partners, business users, and fellow data analysts & scientists to reliably and efficiently access data at scale
* Partner with product & engineering to structure, set up, and execute hypothesis tests to measure the impact of your work on relevant business metrics.
* Understand evolving requirements of the business and expand the capabilities of the data science practice accordingly, including partnering with business stakeholders and product managers to source and scope new projects and evolving our data platform.
* Implement quality control measures and proactively identify and address any data-related issues, ensuring data integrity and enhancing data trust across the organization.
* Continuously improve our performance, stack, and organization by staying updated with the latest industry tools and best practices.

  

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or relevant experience)
* 5+ years experience working in data science or machine learning. Bonus points for experience in consumer tech.
* Deep expertise using Python and SQL for data processing, analytics, and machine learning modeling. Bonus points for experience with other programming languages and delivering production services/algorithms.
* Experience working with time series data, with incomplete and dirty data to extract insights and recommendations for people
* Familiarity with modern data tools and technologies, such as: Snowflake, Amplitude, Python, Airflow, dbt, Fivetran, Stitch, and Looker.
* Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and data integration concepts.
* Strong written & spoken communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong opinions weakly held. You are knowledgeable in your domain and able to move quickly based on that knowledge, but humble enough to change your mind.
* Demonstrated experience & heavy bias for using AI to accelerate your ability to deliver fast, cutting edge results
* Insatiable curiosity and love of learning
* Excellent problem-solving skills
* Flexible and excited to work in fast-paced, changing environment

  

If you are an experienced data professional with a passion for sustainability and the skills to contribute to our mission, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to become a part of our growing team!

**Equal Employment Opportunity**

Palmetto embraces diversity and is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

  

For more about our Privacy Policy, visit: https://palmetto.com/privacy-policy

title: Sales Analytics Analyst - Luxury Business Unit
description:
**Why Gallo?**

With a global portfolio of over 100 unique wine and spirits brands, we are the largest family-owned winery in the world. Apply Today! **Our Brands. Your Future.**

**Position Location: Position will be based in our Modesto Calfornia offices, with an option for occassional telecommuting. You will be expected to live within a commutable distance.**

Are you a data-driven professional with a passion for sales analytics? Join our team as a Sales Analytics Analyst, where you will support the Super Premium+ component of Sales & Operational Planning (S&OP) for Business Units. In this role, you will partner with Sales to manage forecasts and allocations using analytical tools and S&OP work processes, ensuring proper production and deployment plans to meet customer needs. You will collaborate across the organization with functional teams to establish key objectives and drive the Super Premium Business Plan.

As a Sales Analytics Analyst, you will leverage data gathered from Sales Systems and depletions analysis of volume trends, marketing and sales plans, and general market conditions to build demand forecasts using technical tools for data extraction, manipulation, and extrapolation. Working directly with Sales Planning and Channel Directors, you will provide sales analytics and understand key initiatives around distribution, promotions, and market trends.

You will maintain forecasting parameters within SAP IBP Demand Planning to generate accurate forecasts, balancing historical data with market intelligence. Coordinating and building consensus, you will develop production and deployment plans for successful new product launches. Your critical analysis will highlight SKU and geography gaps, enabling General Management to implement necessary corrective actions.

Supporting the S&OP – Demand Meeting process, you will provide insights on program lifts, effectiveness, and market intelligence. You will track new products, distributions, and velocity movement, monitor inventory levels, and make deployment recommendations to meet customer expectations. Managing inventory and product lifecycle, you will influence process adherence and present data-driven analysis to cross-functional teams.

Working closely with the Supply Chain team, you will participate in weekly progress meetings, ensuring communication between demand and supply teams. You will provide forecasts for monthly bottling plans and allocation recommendations, managing forecast error at the SKU/State level using Class A business processes. Your leadership in business analysis will improve forecast accuracy.

Participating in monthly S&OP- Demand Meetings, you will provide quarterly reports on depletions, sales trends, and analytics. Supporting the Demand Manager for all S&OP cycle meetings and contributing to the development of department procedures and performance measures, you will ensure compliance with quality, environmental, and safety regulations.

We value intrapreneurship and ownership behaviors, including thinking boldly, taking appropriate risks, learning from mistakes, showing initiative, and driving innovation. Setting high expectations, engaging in candid discussions, and holding yourself and others accountable are essential to our team's success.

If you are a proactive and analytical professional eager to contribute to a dynamic team, we invite you to apply. Join us in fostering a culture of excellence and continuous improvement. Apply today to become an integral part of our innovative team.

What You Will Need:

* Bachelor's degree plus 3 years experience in forecasting, operations, supply chain, IT, accounting, finance analytical, or Sales and Marketing experience reflecting increasing levels of responsibility; OR High school diploma or State-issued equivalency certificate plus 7 years experience in forecasting, operations, supply chain, IT, accounting, finance analytical, or Sales and Marketing experience reflecting increasing levels of responsibility.
* Experience with MS Excel at an intermediate level.
* Required to travel to company offices, sites, and/or meeting locations for onboarding, training, meetings, and events for development, department needs, and business delivery up to 5% of the time, with or without reasonable accommodation. This may be in addition to travel requirements, if applicable, as listed in this job description.
* Required to be 18 years or older. This may be in addition to other age requirements, if applicable, as listed in this job description.

What Will Set You Apart:

* Bachelor’s degree in operations management, mathematics/statistics, business administration (accounting or finance) plus 5 years experience in forecasting, operations, supply chain, accounting, finance analytical, or sales experience reflecting increasing levels of responsibility.
* Experience analyzing and interpreting general market and economic conditions.
* Experience writing reports, business correspondence and procedure manuals.
* Experience reading and writing SQL queries, Python or other programming languages.
* Experience with SAP, SAP IBP and ORI.
* Experience with database structure and design.
* Experience effectively presenting information and responding to questions from groups of managers and customers.
* Experience defining problems, collecting data, establishing facts and drawing valid conclusions. Experience interpreting an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.
* Experience performing work that is varied and may be somewhat difficult in character, usually involving limited responsibility, requiring frequent evaluation, originality or ingenuity.
* Knowledge of the fundamental concepts, practices and procedures of this particular field of specialization.
* Advanced experience with MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
* Knowledge in the use of consumer media information/tools, spreadsheet software, extrapolation methods and data manipulation or has transferable technical strengths that support quick learning of forecasting tools.

Gallo does not sponsor for employment based visas for this position now or in the future.

**Compensation****:**
=====================

* Hiring Salary Range Posted: $75,600 - $113,400 Annually
* Actual compensation paid within the range will be determined by factors such as the education, experience, knowledge, skills and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.

**Perks & Benefits:**
=====================

* This position includes a competitive benefits package.

title: Implementation Specialist
description:
**About Tekion:**

Positively disrupting an industry that has not seen any innovation in over 50 years, Tekion has challenged the paradigm with the first and fastest cloud-native automotive platform that includes the revolutionary Automotive Retail Cloud (ARC) for retailers, Automotive Enterprise Cloud (AEC) for manufacturers and other large automotive enterprises and Automotive Partner Cloud (APC) for technology and industry partners. Tekion connects the entire spectrum of the automotive retail ecosystem through one seamless platform. The transformative platform uses cutting-edge technology, big data, machine learning, and AI to seamlessly bring together OEMs, retailers/dealers and consumers. With its highly configurable integration and greater customer engagement capabilities, Tekion is enabling the best automotive retail experiences ever. Tekion employs close to 3,000 people across North America, Asia and Europe.

**INTERNAL TITLE: BUSINESS SOULUTIONS SPECIALIST**

  

**Job Description**

Day in and day out, this role is immersed in dealership operations, encompassing both accounting and retail functions within the automotive industry. For accounting, responsibilities include responsibilities include data validations, accounting workflow training such as AP/AR, journal postings, schedule reconciliation, daily deposits, etc. This role necessitates seamless coordination across various internal and external teams to meet deliverables. Additionally, collaborating closely with remote internal teams to ensure operational transparency is crucial.

On the retail side, the role focuses on automotive desking and sales, involving direct customer interaction through F&I Menus and executing deals that align with the intricate regulations of OEMs, lenders, and regional requirements. Validating deals and liaising with diverse stakeholders are essential for meeting deliverables. Furthermore, working closely with onsite implementation and support teams is key to providing comprehensive support. Candidates must possess a deep understanding of the automotive industry dynamics and proficiency with the Tekion platform, emphasizing compliance, organizational rigor, and adaptability.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Provide guidance to internal teams and end users in the most effective methods.
* Provide training and support to end users
* Collaborate with product managers and conversion teams to identify and implement efficiencies that drive accuracy and speed
* Complete checklists and signoffs to drive understanding, transparency and accuracy
* Develop and document feedback/experience from end-users
* Heavy focus on dealership accounting
* Heavy focus on automotive desking and sales *(from interfacing with customers via F&I menus to booking deals that comply with the complex and rigid worlds of OEMs, lenders and regions)*
* Be proactive in learning from others to advance towards a role as a Business Solutions Analyst.
* All other duties as assigned

**Skills and Experience**

* 2+ years of auto or accounting experience or a Bachelor's Degree or Fixed Experience in Dealership
* A passion for challenging the status quo by questioning and improving existing systems, including a playful intelligence
* Experience working in an early-stage startup environment is a plus
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, interacting with all levels of stakeholders
* Established ability to articulate technical jargon into consumable levels of understanding for adult learners
* Proven ability to take customer suggestions or insights and translate them into technical deliverables for internal implementation and product teams
* Ability to travel up to 90%

**Preferred Skills**

* Auto experience
* Accounting experience or a degree in accounting

**Perks and Benefits**

* Competitive compensation and generous stock options
* 100% employer-paid top-of-the-line medical, dental and vision coverage
* Great benefits including unlimited PTO, parental leave and free snacks and beverages
* The opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds from Silicon Valley's most dominant and successful companies
* Be part of an early stage, hyper-growth start-up with the opportunity to grow and prosper
* Work on the latest and coolest technologies – everything is home-grown and built ground-up
* A dynamic work environment with a strong sense of community and collaboration
* The open and transparent culture that encourages innovation, rewards performance and discourages hierarchy
* Exciting opportunities for career growth and development

**Current Tekion Employees – Please apply via Greenhouse Internal Job Board**

Tekion is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, victim of violence or having a family member who is a victim of violence, the intersectionality of two or more protected categories, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

For more information on our privacy practices, please refer to our Applicant Privacy Notice here.

title: Senior Analyst, Strategy & Research
description:
As the **Senior Analyst, Strategy & Research** , you'll team up with the VP, Strategy & Research and other departments to deliver **data-driven analyses** that inform and influence the Company’s decision-makers. You'll also play a key role in developing **tools and dashboards** that streamline information flow and accelerate decision-making. With increasing autonomy, you'll quickly grasp problems, brainstorm and vet potential solutions, gather feedback, and present key learnings and findings.

The primary focus areas for this role include **market research** (supporting acquisitions, development, retail, dispositions, and renovations, with analyses at market, submarket, and site/property levels); **GIS/geospatial analyses; macroeconomics; investor relations; and the latest data and technologies** .

As the Senior Analyst, Strategy & Research, you'll partner with both internal and external stakeholders, including senior management, trade organizations (e.g., ULI, NMHC), vendors, consultants, and outside functional/technical groups, sharing best practices.

**WHO YOU ARE**

* **Knowledgeable.** You bring proven experience in an analytical capacity, demonstrating hands-on expertise in leveraging data to identify trends, solve complex problems, and develop actionable ideas and solutions. Your education and work experience have solidified your passion for research, analysis, data, and related technologies.
* **Organized & Confident.** You're flexible, composed, and adept at prioritizing multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously. You confidently interact with individuals across all levels of the organization and handle pressure with ease.
* **Results-Oriented.** You have an inherent sense of urgency to drive exceptional results while executing your work with precision. You're skilled at creating and communicating clear plans, tracking progress, and keeping your business partners informed every step of the way.
* **Intellectually Curious & Motivated.** You're innately interested in the "why," always seeking to identify opportunities that represent unconventional solutions to complex problems. Resourceful and proactive, you ask smart questions, challenge the status quo, and constantly seek to learn and understand. You're committed to reaching your goals and are eager to volunteer for special projects.
* **Trusted Team Player.** You enjoy collaborating with others and build constructive working relationships that foster the teamwork necessary to deliver great results. You are accountable to your teammates and consistently follow through on commitments.
* **A Strong Communicator.** Your writing and speaking skills are concise, articulate, and effective, allowing you to interact seamlessly with all levels and teams across the organization, build trust, and develop rapport.

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**

* Assist in the underwriting of potential capital allocation decisions (e.g., acquisitions, development, disposition, renovations) from the broader market level to specific sites/properties.
* Work with qualitative and quantitative data (internal and external) to provide analytically-driven insights and solutions, including conducting primary and secondary research.
* Utilize a variety of software tools, including GIS (ESRI/Shapefiles), statistical software (Python/R/Stata), data visualization (e.g., PowerBI, Tableau), automation tools (e.g., Alteryx), and internal databases (Snowflake/SQL), to organize, analyze, and present data.
* Support cross-functional projects by leveraging your analytical and communication skills.
* Develop and utilize project management skills to ensure resources are appropriately leveraged, findings are socialized, and deadlines are met.
* Participate in industry and related organizations to learn best practices on analytical techniques, tools/software, and data.
* Interact frequently with numerous internal stakeholders (e.g., Acquisitions, Development, Dispositions, Retail, Renovations, Investment Officers, Capital Projects, Property Management and Operations, Revenue and Business Intelligence, Treasury, Investor Relations, Data and Analytics, and Financial Planning & Analysis departments), as well as external vendors and consultants.
* Ask critical questions, create alternatives, react to changes in the marketplace, and propose options grounded in thorough analysis.
* Support special projects and ad hoc requests, as needed.
* May have direct or indirect managerial responsibilities for an intern or co-op.

**REQUIREMENTS**

* **Bachelor’s Degree required** , preferably in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance, or Real Estate. Master’s or other advanced degrees preferred.
* **3+ years of experience** in real estate, market research, or similar analytical fields preferred.
* **Must have experience working in an analytical capacity** , preferably for a real estate, consulting, or financial services company.
* **Must have excellent analytical and quantitative skills** , including a strong understanding of data management, statistical and forecasting techniques, financial concepts, and proficiency in data visualization.
* **Experience with data visualization (Tableau, PowerBI), statistical programs (Python, R, Stata), databases (Snowflake, SQL), spatial analysis (GIS, ESRI), and Microsoft Excel are all required.**
* Must be **detail-oriented** , possess good business acumen, and be able to work on numerous projects concurrently while effectively prioritizing workload independently.
* **Must have strong written and oral communication skills.**
Overnight travel, as necessary (approximately 0-10%).  

Salary: $108,000 - $132,000 per year *; in addition to base salary, a discretionary annual bonus is provided.*

*The successful candidate's starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, and qualifications.*

Highlights of the wellbeing benefits for Full-time employees include:

* Physical Wellbeing: Medical, dental, vision care and wellness programs
* Social Wellbeing: Paid holidays, annual vacation time, paid sick leave, new parent benefits, adoption assistance
* Financial Wellbeing: Competitive Compensation, 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, Rent Discounts, FSA/HSA, and company-paid life & disability insurance
* Community Wellbeing: Paid Community Service Hours
* Career Wellbeing: Leadership Development, Tuition Assistance

Learn more about our Total Wellbeing program here.

  

ABOUT US  
Working for Equity Residential (EQR), a leading multi-family real estate investment trust (REIT), means living our purpose: creating communities where people thrive. It means striving to provide the best in apartment living, speaking boldly about new ideas for innovation, and inspiring creativity in the ways we work together.

  

Our portfolio of high-quality properties in urban growth markets – New York City, Boston, Washington DC, Seattle, San Francisco, Southern California, and Denver – provides homes where people most want to live, work and play. We've got the best people in the business, as evidenced by our employee engagement scores and customer loyalty ratings. That’s why our employees say they are proud to work at Equity, a company that gives our residents a place where they can Live Remarkably, and offers a culture where our employees have the opportunity to thrive.

  
  

**Equity Rewards**

When you join Equity Residential, you won’t be treated as simply another employee — you will be considered a partner in our shared success. As such, we are committed to investing in your personal success through a benefits program that supports your Total Wellbeing.

We recognize that everyone has different needs outside of work. That’s why, in addition to a competitive benefits package (medical, dental, vision and paid time off), we offer many unique benefits options to employees, like a comprehensive wellness program, pet insurance, new parent benefits, and paid time off for community service projects. In addition to your next job, you can also find your next home with us! Rent discounts on Equity Residential apartment homes are available to our benefits-eligible employees. The amount of the discount offered is determined based on the market, ranging upwards from 20%.

  
  

**Equity Values**

At Equity Residential, like our residents, our employees come from everywhere. A richly diverse work environment captures top talent, cultivates the best ideas, and creates the widest possible platform for success. By focusing on inclusion, these differences are harnessed to create value — in ideas, business practices, relationships, and employee engagement. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to maintaining a diverse, inclusive and equitable work environment where our employees can thrive.

All aspects of the employment process are merit-based. Every Equity employee is expected to maintain a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment. Equity Residential does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, religion, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, sexual/gender identity/expression, age, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation or related medical conditions), physical or mental disability, national origin, citizenship status, military (including uniformed service member or protected veteran) status, marital status, genetic characteristic or information, ancestry or any other characteristic protected by law. Equity Residential also prohibits retaliation against individuals who report harassment or discrimination, or participate in investigations into such conduct.

title: Business Analyst - REMOTE
description:
Splunk, a Cisco company, is building a safer and more resilient digital world with an end-to-end full stack platform made for a hybrid, multi-cloud world. Leading enterprises use our unified security and observability platform to keep their digital systems secure and reliable. Our customers love our technology, but it's our caring employees that make Splunk stand out as an amazing career destination. No matter where in the world or what level of the organization, we approach our work with kindness. So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you, you. Come help organizations be their best, while you reach new heights with a team that has your back.

ROLE:

Cisco Systems is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to play a key role in the development of a robust Customer Segmentation Model. This individual will work cross-functionally with teams in data analytics, marketing, sales, and technology to document, analyze, and manage requirements that directly impact Cisco’s customer engagement strategies. The ideal candidate will bring strong analytical skills, a foundation in data analytics, attention to detail, and an ability to translate analytical or data-centric business needs into clear business requirement, ensuring alignment with Cisco’s overarching business objectives.

This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to high-visibility projects with the potential to transform the way Cisco understands and interacts with its customers globally to deliver growth at an efficient cost-to-serve.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Requirement Analysis and Documentation

* Collaborate with key stakeholders, including business units, marketing, sales, and technical teams, to gather, analyze, and document business requirements for the customer segmentation model.
* Develop detailed requirement artifacts, such as Business Requirement Documents (BRD), Functional Specifications, and User Stories.
* Define clear acceptance criteria and ensure alignment with business goals and technical feasibility.

Data Analysis and Customer Insights

* Perform foundational data analytics tasks; sourcing, manipulating, and visualising data for analysis to quantify business problem statements and explore business requirements.
* Partner with data scientists and analysts to interpret existing customer data and identify patterns and trends that inform segmentation strategies.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define the segmentation criteria (e.g., demographics, purchasing behavior, geographic regions, etc.) and ensure alignment with business outcomes.

Stakeholder Collaboration

* Facilitate workshops, interviews, and focus groups to elicit requirements and validate the proposed segmentation model.
* Act as a liaison between business units and technical teams, ensuring seamless communication and understanding of the project’s objectives.

Model Development and Testing

* Work closely with data science and engineering teams to ensure that the segmentation model meets business requirements, is scalable, and adheres to best practices.
* Support testing phases, including User Acceptance Testing (UAT), by validating outputs against the defined requirements and acceptance criteria.
* Recommend refinements and adjustments to the model based on stakeholder feedback and testing results.

Change Management and Documentation

* Develop and maintain documentation, including process flows, use cases, and training materials, to support the adoption of the customer segmentation model across the organization.
* Collaborate with change management teams to ensure smooth implementation and onboarding for key users.

Performance Monitoring and Reporting

* Define KPIs and success metrics for the segmentation model in collaboration with business stakeholders.
* Monitor the model’s performance post-implementation and provide regular updates to leadership, including actionable recommendations for ongoing improvements.

REQUIREMENTS:

  

* 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in data analytics, customer insights, or marketing projects.
* Proven experience in gathering, analyzing, and documenting requirements for analytics or data-driven projects.
* Prior experience working on customer segmentation, customer insights, or predictive analytics initiatives is highly desirable.

Technical Skills

* Strong foundation of data analytics, machine learning models, and statistical techniques.
* Basic proficiency in SQL or other query languages is a plus.
* Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
* Proficiency in business process modelling and requirements management tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence, Visio, etc.).

Soft Skills

* Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities with keen attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong interpersonal skills, with a collaborative mindset and ability to influence cross-functional teams.
* High degree of adaptability and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Preferred Qualifications

* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field. Master’s degree is a plus.

Pay Salary Range: $110400 - 139500

Cisco, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. and/or Canada locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. or Canada hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.

U.S. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long -term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings.

Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday (for non-exempt employees), plus a day off for their birthday. Non-Exempt new hires accrue up to 16 days of vacation time off each year, at a rate of 4.92 hours per pay period. Exempt new hires participate in Cisco’s flexible Vacation Time Off policy, which does not place a defined limit on how much vacation time eligible employees may use but is subject to availability and some business limitations. All new hires are eligible for Sick Time Off subject to Cisco’s Sick Time Off Policy and will have eighty (80) hours of sick time off provided on their hire date and on January 1st of each year thereafter. Up to 80 hours of unused sick time will be carried forward from one calendar year to the next such that the maximum number of sick time hours an employee may have available is 160 hours. Employees in Illinois have a unique time off program designed specifically with local requirements in mind. All employees also have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community.

Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco typically pays as follows: .75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota; 1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%; 1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation.

For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.
